Reviews.Title: “Don't be a sucker, this is a time share. If its too good to be true..it is!”
Reviews.Author: Mandy J
Reviews.Content: I live about 80 miles from the Orlando area so my husband and I take many..many weekend trips to the Disney area. I've stayed just about everywhere. My friends and I try this one out. Knowing Westgate and being held hostage in their sales pitch I should have known better to stay here. You get "Florida rates" just to sucker you in. You have to go to several desks at check in which when crowded can take several hours. Yes, I said hours. They try and sucker you in to their 90 minute resort tour and you get complimentary Buffett breakfast. Do Not Do this. It's where they trap their prey!! It will turn in to hours of them trying to sell you on a timeshare. I didn't do it, because I know their game, being an expert Orlando Traveler and being previously sucked into it. The game room is ok, but the Ice Cream place is so far away that you should drive to it. The deli and sports bar are not impressive at all. I wouldn't even call it a sports bar. They sell drinks at a bar and they have a tv you can watch. I was put in a handicapped room. My husband and I are not handicapped. The shower was so small bc of the fold out seat. The beds were comfortable though. Checking out you have to put all your sheets and towels by the front door & take your trash to the trash closet. Oh did I mention you have to pay $9.95 a day plus a .70 sales, and .60 Resort tax for "Resort Fees" They will lie and said its for your Ammenity Card. I hope my review will help some travelers that don't know any better stay away. Look somewhere else. This place really isn't worth all the hassle and harassment you will get. Trust me..you'll find out if you chose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Would I stay here again? Yes”
Reviews.Author: from_the_mitten12
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews, some things were spot on....some were not. I was worried abt sales pressure, bugs, poor service, etc...whatever people have commented/complained abt. We exchanged thru II for a spring break week. We checked in on a Friday (May 30, 2012) leaving on Good Friday. Arrived at 3pm and check in was about 30 minutes...after we checked in, ushered to another counter and was asked if we wanted to sign up for a 90 min presentation. ABSOLUTELY NO PRESSUE AT ALL. The girl was very polite when we said no thank you. THAT WAS THE END OF IT...no phone calls, no pressure, like I read. I honestly think those reviews are from people who somehow got a deal and had the presentation as part of their package...well, you dont get something for free - you agreed to the presentation, full well knowing it was a sales pitch. Check out was a bit worse - we decided to check out on Thurs night, cuz we planned to leave very early Fri morning. Two guys behind the counter, about 4 families in line and it took almost an hour to finally get our chance. They should have called for help. Also walked away with our invoice - noticing it was someone else's - the guy must have entered the wrong room number. Got that sorted out and shook our heads as we left. Not the best impression upon leaving. We stayed in the 5600 building..it was near two different pools - Definately recommend pool #13 - and plan to reserve ur chair/table early in the morning (9am ish) cuz if you go later, all the chairs/tables are filled up. We stayed in what Interval listed as a 1 bedroom with LK (Limited kitchen) = translates to Studio.The pictures of the studio on Westgate's website are accurate of what our room looked like. It was a lock off, attached to a 2 bedroom. When we arrived, the lock off door was not locked. Got a glance at the 2 bedroom - it was very nice and we were envious. Called the front desk to ask to upgrade, could not since it was a holiday week and the resort was full and requested they come and lock the door. Someone was there within 10 minutes to do so. The room was decorated a bit dated, but it had granite counters in the kitchen and bathroom. Dishes/silverware/glasses/cups/dish soap/extra paper towel/tissue/t paper were provided, so we didnt have to buy any for the week. Room service showed up on Tuesday with fresh towels and to replace garbage bags/paper towel/tp etc. Would have liked a broom to sweep the floors. Nice screened in balcony = no bugs. Loved hearing the water fountain in the little man-made lake behind our building. No issues with parking. We ate off site every night - plenty of restaurants to choose from. Grounds were nice and clean. The location is one of the best things abt Westgate. 5 minute drive to Disney. About a 40 min drive to Cocoa beach/Kennedy space center. We didnt go to Universal or any of the other parks, but those were close by also. Definately a family friendly resort - so close to Disney and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Exchange”
Reviews.Author: Hongkonger65
Reviews.Content: First off, like so many others, I was concerned about booking this time share property after reading the many reviews on Trip Advisor. We exchanged through the Interval International network for the spring break week and were prepared for 1) big crowds, 2) a time share pitch and 3) a so-so experience. This actually turned out great for us. The resort is HUGE and great for families who are going to the theme parks. Our daughter was playing softball at the ESPN Wide World of Sports and the resort is perfectly situated for that. On entering the main check-in area, we were pleasantly directed to the registration counter and everyone was very nice. We did not wait in line at all (approximately 1:00 pm on a Sunday) and it took only about 10 minutes to get our keys and be handed off to a very nice time share associate. This was very low key and when we said that we would not be available for the presentation breakfast, we were sent on our way to building 4000 (which is newer and close to the main reception area). There appears to be some construction planned for in front of the unit we stayed in, but that did not impact us at all. When you are at the parks, swimming or at sporting events all day, this is not really important. If we wanted a view, we would have selected another vacation destination or property. Our unit was a huge one bedroom (I assume a deluxe) with a full kitchen, laundry facilities in the unit and a large lanai. The flat screen TVs, jacuzzi, separate shower/bathroom and furnishings were very nice. It would have been great to have an extra toilet in this unit (it is obviously a lock-off), but that was our only complaint. We did not have any door bell ringing, but the walls are a bit thin and we heard our neighbors in the morning. As with most condo/time share properties, room cleaning happens once a week. We actually like this for privacy. If you book this property thinking it is a romantic hotel-type resort, you will be disappointed. If you are a seasoned time share exchanger, you may be very pleased (as we were). In addition, if you need transport to the airport, Caesar's is very good - affordable, convenient and courteous. Shuttles to Disney are limited, so a vehicle (especially with the large size of the resort) is a good idea. Parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: barzdiprocky
Reviews.Content: I stayed a whole week at this vacation spot (timeshares owned and rented also location) with an owner. For the most part I enjoyed my stay at this location! The facilities were modern, beautiful and clean! I was in building 5000 and it was immaculate! The parking was a bit difficult and no luggage carts to use when you need to load and unload your car but we managed to make it in two trips. When we checked in the first day we were ushered to a second employee to discuss a presentation (and since my friend was already an owner she knew the spill so we declined the offer for this presentation). We rested very well in the evenings and nights as the one bedroom unit we had was very comfortable and it was noise free. We did our own laundry while we were there and never asked for room service; if you place your garbage bag outside your unit door the service will pick it up by the next morning. If you ask for anything they offer they will try to acommodate you. The shuttle service to the disney parks could be better to accommodate people who want to stay till the finale fireworks or shows at night. I think it was very inconvenient to have to abide by their times only and enjoy the parks to the fullest. So we paid $14 or $15 per day to park our vehicle at the parks for 6 whole days. Check-out was simple; we cleaned our room as far as placing dirty linens in the laundry room and putting the dirty dishes in the dishwasher and turned it on, and placed any garbage bags outside our door when we left. A great place to stay! Shorts and Sandals was a great place to stop for a drink or food, great service and casual atmosphere. When you order food please prepared for very large amounts of food. It was amazing! Thanks again for a great vacation spot!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: miniv
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I arrived at the Westgate Town Center on the morning of Sunday, April 8th for our 5-night Disney vacation. Let me just preface this review by saying the Westgate Marketing team is full of liars that really know how to stretch the truth. The first major negative of our trip was an unavoidable $65 taxi ride from the Orlando airport to the resort – it would have been accommodating of Westgate to provide some sort of free or reduced transportation to and from the airport for its guests, since the resort is roughly 25 miles away from the airport – but apparently that is entirely too much to ask. So we finally arrived at the (seemingly) beautiful Westgate Town Center around noon on Easter Sunday. Now don’t let the exterior appearance of the resort fool you – the pretty landscape, the large, beautiful lobby, and the sophisticated-looking buildings – there is no denying that the physical appearance of the resort is beautiful. But after only a little time it became obvious that the Westgate people dedicate most of their resources into the appearance of the resort, rather than the happiness and comfort of their guests. Our first grievance with the resort came upon check-in. After we were checked-in by a young lady and given our room keys, we were immediately and UNWILLINGLY shuffled along a conveyor belt to another representative much like a cattle-call. We did not understand why we had to meet with another representative after we had already checked-in and gotten our keys – all we wanted to do was go up to our room and unpack after a long morning of traveling. Now this representative was very charismatic, and slyly talked us into signing up for a “90-minute tour of the resort” on Tuesday morning. We weren’t sure why he was strongly encouraging us to sign up for a tour of the resort two full days after we had arrived, but whatever. We don’t know how it happened, but he then swindled us into leaving a $20 deposit for our tour reservation! And after he rushed us through signing a pink waiver with a lot of fine print (that we did not have time to read), we came to realize that we were signing up for a timeshare sales presentation that we 100% HAD NO INTEREST IN BUYING. We asked some other guests what it was all about, and they urged us to AVOID the presentation at all costs – they told us that it was actually a high-pressure sales pitch to try to sell us a timeshare, and in most cases, the presentation lasted roughly 4-5 hours (not 90 minutes) and involved several managers and higher-ups that applied a great deal of pressure to buy a timeshare. After hearing these horror stories, we decided to skip the presentation and cut our losses, leaving the $20 deposit at the front desk. Our next grievance came with our room (located in building 5200). Let me just say that the architect who designed these rooms did a very poor job and was severely overpaid. Our bedroom wall was actually the front wall of the unit, meaning that our bedroom window was directly next to the walkway outside our front door. Being early to bed every night, we had a lot of trouble sleeping because we heard all the various noises of people and kids walking by our unit. We were also right next to a staircase, so anytime someone walked up or down the stairs, we could hear them right in our bedroom. The ceilings were also paper-thin, as we heard footsteps through our ceilings every time someone walked around upstairs. In addition, when we booked our stay at Westgate, we booked a king-sized bed in our room. However, what we received was a rickety full-sized bed, with a crusty old comforter and sheets as crinkly as sandpaper. The mattress was hard and thin, and gave very little support to a guest who would be walking miles upon miles at Disney parks all week-long. The televisions were old and outdated, the WI-FI was NOT FREE, and furthermore, the leather sofa in the living room area was filthy, with dirt and grime stains all over it. Our room was just flat-out dirty and outdated. But what really ticked us off the most, was after all the inborn cleanliness issues with our room that I just described, housekeeping did not come to clean our room until Thursday afternoon!!!! (again, we arrived Sunday morning). It took 4-and-a-half days for them to bring us clean towels and take out our garbage = GROSS! HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!! A couple other negatives – the pools were dirty and unkempt. There was a very nasty and impatient young employee named Alexandra that worked the lake activities area (she was quite rude to us). There were no sidewalk paths when we wanted to leave the resort by foot. There were golf carts zooming all over the place because the resort was so large and unwalkable. And finally, most of the clientele that stayed at the resort were not of the highest class (I’ll leave it at that). The lone bright spot of this gigantic resort was the Sports Bar/lounge named “Shirts and Sandals.” The food there was excellent and affordable, the portion sizes were large, the service was impeccable, and the overall atmosphere was friendly and fun. We ate three meals at this lounge and were very happy (and full) each and every time. In closing, I would DEFINITELY NOT stay at this resort again in the future, and recommend that you not either!

Reviews.Title: “worst place in the world to stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bill j
Reviews.Content: These people lie to you to get you in the door the room we booked was not what we thought. If you are staying here and you are not an owner , forget it!!! the will treat you like dirt...... no upgrades, they have this big cookout , and your not invited, after you paid your money!!! they take your credit card and charge it up front,when the are only suppose to hold it to reserve a room. please do not go to westgate whatever you do. go somewhere else!!!!!!! the movie theater was out of order for a week,cuetomer service was at an all time low,the maids were nice though. I will never stay here again...... vacation ruined!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay. Beautiful modern room. Close to Disney, Restaurants and Shopping”
Reviews.Author: 2views
Reviews.Content: I did a timeshare getaway vacation purchase for a 2-2-0 (sleep 2, occupancy 2, bdrms 0= Hotel Rm or Efficiency/Studio) at Westgate Vacation Villas. If you plan to visit Disney, this resort is about as close as you can get without being on the Disney property itself. Westgate Town Center is 3 blocks off of US-192, a major road with national chain restaurants and shopping, including SuperTarget, Walmart. I was amazed at the size of this complex. It includes several blocks with 2-level town homes, about 6 huge 8-story tall condo buildings which I estimate have about 720 units each, and the monsterous regal Town Center building which has suites, efficiency and hotel rooms. Additionally, there are various shops, eateries on the complex. Check-in is at the Town Center building. It is stated that earliest room check-in is 4pm. Knowing this, I planned to check in several hours after 4pm to avoid the rush, but as the day unfolded I arrived at exactly 4pm. There are 40 or so parking spots out front, but they were all full, so I continued on to the side of the building and walked to the front entrance. (A previous reviewer complained that there was no parking so he drove for over 10 minutes hunting for a space. There is a huge lot with ample parking on the side of the building. Understand that this is a huge resort accommodating thousands of guests. The front desk and parking area will always be busy. If you get that stressed about not getting the parking space closest to the front door, you definately need a vacation.) Once inside Town Center, check-in counters line the whole back wall of the entry with a maze of theatre-line ropes to coral guests. Unfortunately, there are too few staff actually checking guests in, so there may be a 30min or longer wait in line before making your way to the check-in counter. Once there, check-in was fast (10 min). I did not get approached about timeshare sales or special discount-offer meetings. But, having been to timeshare resorts before, I know better than to agree to these offers. A promised 90-minute max timeshare sales pitch is always 4 or more hours and, when you finally escape, you will feel totally exhausted and angry with yourself for not getting up and walking away sooner. The promised free meals, discount tickets, or other perks, are never worth the lost vacation time spent at these presentations, the stress of sitting through a 4 hr presentation, or the risk that you will be tempted enough to actually buy. (If you are new to timeshare sales, what ever fantastic price they offer, you should know that the same, or similar, units can be purchased from disenchanted owners on the aftermarket for 10% of what you will pay at the presentation.) The room I was given upon check-in was in Town Center #40xx, and for 1 or 2 people, it is perfect. I am posting pictures. Everything was new, spotlessly clean, and the bed was plush, one of the best beds I have ever had. There was a full size frig, 2 burner stove, micro, washer/dryer. They supplied a toaster and blender, too. I typically have blender smoothies for breakfast and margaritas for poolside. Unfortunately, the blender, although brand new, was unable to do any more than stir liquid, regardless of speed. I put a banana, strawberries, juice and ice cubes in the blender and tried all the blender speeds. The blades didn't touch the fruit or cubes, just stirred the juice in the center. (The plastic pitcher is too wide for the narrow blades) I had to shake the blender up/down in the air to force the fruit to find the blades. The free Tue pool breakfast is light continental, juice, coffee, cheap danish, oranges. Didn't appeal to me. The pools get crowded, noisy, and inconsiderate folks reserve pool lounges with towels early in the morning and never show up at the pool til later in the afternoon. The staff should, but don't, discourage this activity, or remove towels from vacated chairs. Unlike Las Vegas resorts, where pool staff are always visible, offering towels and drinks, and cleaning the area, I never did notice any pool staff during my week stay, and if they were there they certainly weren't serving the guests. When all pool lounges were taken, I put my towel on the lawn area next adjacent to the pool and found this to be quite adeqate, as did several other guests. As much as I would like to trust others, when at a hotel or resort, if I am leaving my valuables in the room, I always lock my valuables (cash, creditcards, ipod, camera, etc.) in the room safe. When I arrived, I noticed that the room safe power was out (batteries that control the lock were dead). I called maintenance and they dispatched someone within 20 min. Unfortunately, it was the wrong person, the one who can access your safe if you forget your passcode. She had to call the locksmith. I didn't wait, but took all my valuables to the pool with me. When I returned a few hours later, the safe was repaired. I consider this very good service for quickly handling such a minor issue when in the throughs of mass guest check-in at the front counter. Several reviewers complained about not getting daily maid service. This is not a standard hotel. It states in the material provided at check-in that linen service is provided only 1 or 2 times per week. This is an effort to lower cost for the resort and minimize impact on the environment. Hotels and resorts have been moving in this direction for the past 10 years. Frequent travelers already know this and many of us practice this at home. I don't feel the need to have bed sheets or towels laundered daily, at a hotel or at home. Do some people actually change there bed sheets every day at home? Although I had a rented car, I chose to walk fm the resort to US-192 for shopping and meals. It is only 3 blocks to US-192 and Golden Corral, Ponderosa, Sizzler, etc are only a couple blocks further. I actually walked to Target (about 4 miles away). That was a bit far. Next time I took the car. Check-out for me was at 5 AM. There was no waiting. It was quick and effortless. Overall, I would say that this is a fine resort for a family style vacation, especially if you wish to spend most of your time at Disney and area attraction. The complex is large, safe, has wide open landscaped spaces to walk, bicycles and paddle boats to rent, and a activites center for small children. There is not much to do at the resort but sit at the pool. I spent half my free time at the pool and half at the beach (Cocoa Beach, and Treasure Island). For those looking for a party atmosphere, this resort is definitely not the place. For that, head to the beach resorts, or another orlando resort.

Reviews.Title: “Town Center was EXCELLENT.”
Reviews.Author: babydec07
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant after reading the reviews of others, but we were very pleasantly surprised and will stay in this resort again. We loved the ammenities the resort offered and everything was beautiful. The kitchen in our unit was very nicely stocked & we were able to cook several meals there. Great value on an excellent resort!

Reviews.Title: “Town Center was a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: nwb
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit apprehensive about staying here before we arrived but we really enjoyed our stay! We own at Westin and Marriott and have always stayed at one of their resorts. We were pleased with the Westgate Town Center. The Good -The rooms that we occupied were new, spacious, nicely furnished, and the beds were very comfortable. -Complimentary continental breakfasts were served @ the pool on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 8:30-10:30. -Maid stopped by mid-week to see if we needed towels. -We had to leave a day early due to a death in the family and our checkout was expedited. -Little pressure to attend timeshare presentation -Location was excellent, close to I-4 and the Disney Parks. The Not So Good -Checkin took way too long! We arrived on Saturday night at 10 and never expected to wait --30 minutes to get our room assignment. -Walls are thin and some guests were very noisy. -People reserve pool chaises with towels and at times, there were at least 30 chairs with towels on them but unused. This should not be allowed. We are returning in early July with our daughter and grandson for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Awful customer service at a nice resort”
Reviews.Author: James K
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this resort suffers from some of the worst customer service I have ever had the misfortune to experience. The property has many amenities, and the rooms are very nice, (although the decor is dated, and the tvs are ancient). Everything else needs serious work. - The directions given by our booking site (bookit.com - beware!) were totally inaccurate and led to our driving around for an hour on the wrong side of the Interstate. This was not the resort's fault, BUT: - Repeated calls to the resort for directions went unanswered, and only resulted in waiting on hold for 20 minutes; it seems impossible to get an actual person on the phone who can help. - The line to check-in was ridiculously long (if you are not attending a timeshare presentation), with only two people working alongside ten empty check-in stations; the resort is seriously understaffed. - Three requests to speak with a manager to resolve serious issues with the property went unanswered. I was told someone would be with me shortly each time, but no one ever came or called our room as promised. - Although we had called before arriving to request a crib be delivered to our room, and were told again at check-in it was on its way, it was not delivered until 9 PM, an hour after our daughter's bedtime, and then only because we finally got ahold of the manager-on-duty. (In case you need it, the manager-on-duty's extension seems to be x45999) - Although check-out is at 10 AM, housekeeping came and knocked at 8:30 and again at 9:30 to see if we were gone, and then started cleaning part of the apartment at 9:50, before we had vacated. This is a really nice place, and very close to Disney, but the terrible customer service was almost unbearable, and I would advise anyone against staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual location for a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Found this VERY cheap deal on Hotwire.com to stay at this "hotel". Check-in was a breeze, despite it being peak time on a Saturday afternoon. The check-in clerk was surprised that I was on my own as most other guests were couples or families on vacation, but I guess that spared me the timeshare sell. I was in block 59 towards the back of the property and I had a normal 2 bedded room with small kitchen etc. I was concerned that as everyone else was on vacation, there would be a lot of noise, but once inside the room it was very quiet and peaceful. I didn't use the restaurant or bar but did take the opportunity to walk around the extensive grounds. I also walked to 192 to find a restaurant (of which there are many in the area). Overall, not as bad as some reviews had reported and I had nothing really to complain about. However, it was curious that during my 4 night stay, my room was only serviced twice. I couldn't work out whether that was because I was inside the room at the time the maid stopped by or whether it was because it wasn't a regular hotel. It wasn't a problem to me and I didn't even bother to report it to the front desk. Parking was no problem either at any time, as reported by other reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!!!!! Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bgmeidl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came home from Florida today and I promised myself I would not skip reviewing this resort. The resort is beautiful at first sight. Don't let this fool you. We were there for four days ans our room was not cleaned ONCE! Not even enough cleaned towels or the bed made with clean linens. When we went to out HIGH PRESSURE timeshare bullying session I mentioned the lack of attention to our room and was told that they give priority to owners. Ya like I wanna own anything there after hearing that. Last I checked we did pay for the room we stayed in. Not to mention I personally witnessed the attendant in the game room make a 12 year old little boy cry---do they save that for owners too? Save yoour time and money and stay somewhere else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again will we stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren R
Reviews.Content: Yikes. My family lives about 90 minutes from Orlando attractions and we visit at least once a month and stay overnight. I thought I got a great deal on travelocity but unfortunately it was a joke! We arrived around 4:00 on Friday and it took 90 minutes just to get checked in. The line of customers was snaked through the lobby waiting to check in. There were only about six front desk agents and at least 15 empty computers. Obviously they are understaffed! I requested an upgrade and was told there were none available. Then we got to our room which was advertised as a studio and turned out to be smaller than a dorm room. Not even a chair to sit on in the room because it was probably only about 250 square feet with two double beds. There are mirrors lining all the walls to help it feel larger, but it only adds to the outdated 80's teal carpet and linens. The room smelled of mold/mildew and even after we opened the window the smell never dissipated. The bathroom was nicely renovated but that was it. After we got home from dinner we decided to take the children to the game room and ice cream parlor. It was quite a long walk from our 5900 building and luckily an employee on a golf cart drove by and we flagged him down for a ride. He told us when we were ready to leave that we could walk to the front desk and someone from the bell staff would take us back to our room. NOT! Around 10:15 we went to the resort lobby and the check in line was still so back up that the bell staff told us they were too busy to take us to our building. So we had to hike with the kids (ages 6 and 3) all they way back to our room. The amenities of paddle boats and mini golf look fun...too bad they closed at 6:00! Pick another resort. This place was poorly organized with unaccomidating staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you like being lied to on a constant basis!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth B
Reviews.Content: I did one review already for Westgate Villas and then realized that wasnt even where we stayed. After being somewhat nice in that review, I decided to review the correct resort and just tell it like it happened. My fiance and I decided to take a trip to Disney with her sister and two boys (3 & 4 yrs old). We start looking for hotels and I think I have found a good one...Westgate Villas. We agree that this sounds like a great hotel but my future sister-in-law keeps looking and finds an even better deal. We were going to have another person traveling with us and she found "Westgate Town Center" with multiple rooms, a kitchen, and living area. This sounds great!!! I go to the website and I see that they have a Florida resident discount of 10%. I am proud for finding a good deal but she calls me a few minutes later and she has found a better deal. If we book early we can get 20% off the same room. The extra person cant make it so we decide on the one room deluxe villa. The more we read about the place, with all of these great amenities, the better it sounds and the price is just what we wanted to spend. So we are sitting around the house a few days later planning out our schedule for the Disney parks and we decide we are going to spend the entire day at Magic Kingdom from 9am - 12am. I make the comment that we were going to be late getting in and it would be nice to have the next day free to just relax. That got the wheels turning and we started looking at what it would cost us to add an extra day. I called and found that we couldnt get the extra day at the same low rate but we could still take advantage of the single day discount of 10% for booking early. So we did it. How did we get so lucky to find this you might ask.... It turns out we only thought we were lucky. We drive through the night and arrive the next morning after spending 7.5 hours on the road. We eat some breakfast and check out Downtown Disney just to kill time until 11:30 when I was told we could try to get an early check-in. We get to the Town Center and cant find anywhere to park. This must be a great place because there are people everywhere. After driving around for ten minutes, I ask a guy riding by in a golf cart where I needed to park to check in. He tells me to find a spot out front or parallel park along the curb. What a great idea, if only I could find an empty spot out front or see the curb to parallel park. Oh well, I just go to the nearest parking lot and park there. I tell the rest of the crew to stay at the car since it shouldnt take but a few minutes to check in based on my previous experience staying in hotels. Notice I said hotel, I was not aware that this was a timeshare resort. So I step into this elaborate lobby and just stand there looking around trying to figure out where I need to go. There seems to be people everywhere and it looks like complete chaos. Normally this is where I would expect someone at the front desk, directly in front of me, to be of assistance. Nope, that is obviously not part of the package at Westgate Town Center. So I proceed to walk toward the back where I see some ropes with a line. I wait in the line for about ten minutes only to be told that I need to go to a different line. So, I move to the other line and I am immediately greeted by a pleasant young lady who asks my name and gives me a sheet with my reservation information. Fast forward about 45 minutes and I finally make it to the check-in desk. Keep in mind that this is on a Sunday at 11:30 in the morning so it is expected to be a little busy. The gentleman at the desk takes care of all of my needs and confirms my resort fee charge of $68 plus the $50 deposit. He provides me with an extra card key and then calls for a guest assistant to help me complete my check in. The guest assistant takes me 20 feet to another desk where a VIP host welcomes me and commences to telling me about the mandatory 90 minute tour of the facility that was part of my vacation package. Funny thing is I dont remember getting a vacation package. I just reserved a room for six nights. Oh, there was some sort of mixup and I was booked as an owner so I am entitled to free amenities (I was told that was what the resort fee was for) and a welcome package. I would also get complimentary breakfast buffet and free meals at the pools. Wow!!! My luck is really good. I spend 90 minutes on a tour of the facility and I get a welcome package, breakfast buffet, and free meals at the pools. Maybe that mandatory tour wasnt so bad after all. So, when should I schedule this tour? On the extra day I reserved for us to relax after spending 15 hours at Magic Kingdom with two young children of course. The only catch is this is such a good deal that I have to give them $20 to reserve my spot but I will get it back after the tour...along with some gift cards. Well, I get it back and I just watched 3 other people somehow get the same great deal so what the heck. Ok, that is all taken care of and its only been 1.5 hours so lets go see the room. Up we go to the room and it is exactly what I expected. Very nice compared to the hotels I usually stay in. Back down to get the rest of the gang and show them how good of a deal we got and tell them about all the great stuff we got because of a mistake when they booked me as an owner of something. Now to check out this free welcome package. Six cookies!!! I feel like my 90 minutes is worthwhile already. After we got back to our "villa" after a long day at Magic Kingdom, we found that both the bed and the sleeper bed had been made, we had fresh clean towels again, the trash had been taken out, and everything had been straightened up after the two little tornados we brought with us had swept through the room the previous night. The next morning we attend our 90 minute tour that provides a horrible little breakfast buffet that even the kids wouldnt eat. Things started sounding fishy when some guy stands up and announces that someone had just bought a room and to mark it off the list. Our tour guide, er sales person, then starts laying it out for us. She has a great offer for us and we are so lucky to have been accidently booked as owners because that gives her the opportunity to offer us some special deals. Wait a minute, I am not interested in any special deals, I just want my $20 back and we will be on our way. Wait, we just gave you a free breakfast buffet, just give me a few minutes to explain this wonderful offer. Well, we're even then because we didnt eat your free buffet. Let me ask you, if money didnt matter, would you be interested in staying here at least two weeks every year in a room like we stayed in last night. Sure, it is very nice. Then give me a few minutes to explain. Sure, I agreed to 90 minutes so lets hear it. 4.5 hours later... No, No, and No, I am not interested in buying a timeshare, paying off a timeshare, or prepaying for a week vacation in a timeshare. I just want my $20 back so we can go get something to eat and RELAX. Ok, what price would it take to get you in on this great deal. FREE. Ok, let me go talk to my boss and see if I can work that out. Just forget it, I just want my $20 back now... So much for relaxing the extra day we paid for. As for the rest of our stay, our beds were never made again and the linens were never changed in 6 days, our garbage was never taken out again and wasnt even picked up when we left it outside our door. We ran out of toilet paper and when we called for it after the second day of using kleenex and napkins, they finally got some to us after over an hour. Needless to say, we didnt feel so lucky in the end when we got treated horribly after turning down their great offers. The room is definitly nice and it was well worth the price we paid but with our extra day wasted and the way we were treated afterwards, I would rather have paid twice the price and enjoyed my stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for a week....but don't buy a timeshare!!”
Reviews.Author: MamaTraveler1
Reviews.Content: OK here is what I would say about this place: stay for a week but do not buy a timeshare. My husband and I bought one here a few years back and upon our very first visit the following year, we regretted the decision. The staff is super friendly and accommodating while you are writing a check and signing the timeshare paperwork. But the minute you are an owner and you have any sort of issue or problem (and trust me, you will have issues and problems) the staff tends to get uncaring and often RUDE. You would not believe how many people I have dealt with there who had me baffled about how rude they were to an owner. If it was a random situation or one person I would never mention it....but SO many staffers there were rude and unhelpful so I feel it needs to be mentioned. Where owners are concerned, there is NO such thing as 'customer service'. None whatsoever. So be warned about that. The place tends to get REALLY crowded during holiday weeks. Yes, I know that can happen anywhere, but this was beyond the norm as far as I could tell. The pool was so crowded that we literally could hardly move around (and good luck finding a pool chair; there was like one chair for every 50 people, if that). My biggest complaint was the lack of someone working there to make sure things were safe at the pool. There were kids (and even adults) acting like animals in the pool, totally rough-housing and jumping off things they should not have been jumping off of. It was very dangerous and twice my daughter got hurt by careless people who were acting like lunatics in the pool. I felt that in those conditions, the place should have one person there to tell people to stop doing things like jumping off the center island into crowds of swimmers and wrestling in the water. We eventually left the pool because my child was hurt (we would have left anyway because it was a miserable place to be....not relaxing or fun at all). In situations like that, it would be nice for there to be an employee watching the pool and taking care of problems. At one point, early after our purchase of the timeshare, we were assigned to an agent who was seemingly very nice and helpful. "Anything you need, you call me!.." he kept saying, and he even gave us his cell phone number. We called him about something and he picked up immediately and was happy to help. He also picked up really fast when he was going to meet with us to talk about upgrading our timeshare (THANK GOD we didn't do that!!!). Then we had a problem....a big problem....and we went to management. We called our agent on his cell and....surprise!! He didn't pick up and after several repeat calls and messages to him, he never called us back. Years later, he still hasn't returned our call LOL. So I guess if you are happy, they are happy. If you have a problem, they are useless. We also were promised a lot of things at this hotel that were never delivered....things that were a huge part of the reason we bought the time share.They promised a big waterpark with water slides. Several years later, that park is still nothing more than some ugly poles sticking out of the ground. On our visit last year, they had a big inflatable waterslide but they charged a fortune to use it. So much for getting what you pay for. We were urged to go to "one of the best dinner shows in town" and when we got there it was like a converted strip-club. It was gross and smelly. The show was horrible and the food was enough to make me gag. I later found out that they are somehow affiliated with the hotel (perhaps the hotel gets money every time they get a sucker, er, customer, to go to this place?) We felt duped by them and mislead.....but at that point this was no surprise. Oh and their shuttles to the amusement parks? Forget about it. They have hardly any type of schedule (even during the busy holiday weeks, the shuttles hardly make any trips, and far from what would accommodate the amount of guests who want to use this service). The first day we were there we were told we couldn't get on the early shuttle because it was booked up and there wouldn't be another one. Thank goodness we had a car. Lame. They had an "owners luncheon" that was SO crowded because they were letting non-owners in (I know this for a fact). Halfway through the lunch they ran out of food. I could go on and on about the problems we had with this place but the thing that bugs me the most is the lack of customer service. We had a lot of issues there with our timeshare (things I can't even get into on here) and they just DO NOT CARE. At one point my husband was on the phone with one of their agents and she kept saying "mmmHmmm" to everything he said. She was totally disinterested in talking to him, You will find this from everyone starting at the clerks behind the desks to the top of management. They don't care about you once you sign the timeshare papers. Trust me, we had a lot of serious issues that they shrugged off. It is infuriating. The good things about this place are that it is pretty and it is close to a lot of things people go to Orlando for. It is easy to get to Disney from here. The hotel is very close to a lot of restaurants and shopping (which is a good thing since there are no real restaurants on site). The hotel is lovely in appearance and the rooms are very nice. But other than decor and location, this place is NOT all that great. In fact, the only reason I gave this two stars is because of the location and decor. But if it wasn't for those two things, this place would get one star (only because there isn't an option for less than that).I would definitely book a week here....but if I could go back and do it all again we would NOT buy here. No way. If we could sell this timeshare, we would have done so long ago (don't let them tell you it is easy to sell; it is not). I could go on and on about what I don't like about this place but I'll end it here. I highly suggest not buying here, though. I am not the only reviewer who has valid reasons as to why not. But the lack of caring and customer service (among everything else) makes me mad that we are spending our hard earned money on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: tlilly01
Reviews.Content: Made my reservation and was in a very small room; but talked to the front desk and was moved into a perfect room for our stay. Everything was clean and wonderful! I would recommend this (especially the 1 bedroom - not suite) to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: Mary Beth J
Reviews.Content: We were only at Westgate Vacation Villas for one night- but wanted to say how wonderful Libia Rodriguez was to us-she went out of her way to make us feel relaxed and at home-also was a tremendous help with directions to the Orlando airport, and other hotels where family was staying-she was an absolute joy and a wonderful ambassador for your resort-thank you so very much Libia!

Reviews.Title: “Check in Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Ebony G
Reviews.Content: After a long day of traveling all you want to do is check into your room and relax right? Well at West Gate you have to wait a little longer. When we pulled into their gates I was impressed at how massive the property was. It seems like they have all types of accommodations but the major problem is they all check- in at one central area. When walking in check in reminded me of checking in at an airport, only an airport would have been much faster. It took us just over an hour to check-in. After you check-in they walk you over to the Time-Share desk and they give you their whole speech. They must have sensed our annoyance as they only gave us one rebuttal and let us go right away. We were in building 6001 which is to the left and behind where you check in. The rooms were very modern, which was almost worth the wait. We requested the top floor, to try and avoid noise, and I must say you could not hear anything in the rooms on either side of you. HOWEVER, we were close to the elevator so in the morning we could hear the noise as people were coming and going.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare nightmare, rude staff, room and amenities not as promised”
Reviews.Author: Edenfamily88
Reviews.Content: We got conned into buying a one week package last year, we were promised all the amenities that an owner would receive ie. Free owner lunch and breakfast everyday. We also were told we would not have to listen to any time share pitches again. There were 3 owner meals the entire time, the agent had lied about everyday. We also had to sit thru another 90 minute time share presentation where we were lied to every step of the way, including them pretending that they held a unit at a wrong low price and what a deal we got. (eyeroll) Even when we complained about the safe not working, dining room light switch didn't work as well as several other problems they just didn't care. We had building 5600 and it was outdated our condo at Caribe Cove was much nicer for hal the price. We were told only owners get the nicer unit. If your trying to entice someone you think they would give you the best of the best? This resort is overpriced for the rooms and if you look around you can find newer, nicer condos for half the price. Drunk parents at the pool was disgusting, one even made his daughter vomit because he got mad and held her head underwater until she vomitted (all over the pool deck) I called security, but by the time they arrived all that was left was the vomit as the family went back up to the room. Its "ok" to stay here but you'd get less hassle and better value of your money staying at another condo. I wouldn't recomment this company or resort to family or friends. Stay away from Westgate, alll they do is lie thru their teeth. Do NOT get sucked into this timeshare.

Reviews.Title: “Another Good Week in Kissimmee - Westgate Town Center”
Reviews.Author: PA-Short-Term
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been owning a mid-Fibruary week since 1999 at the Westgate Town Center. Every time we come down to stay at our unit it is the same experience. The unit is extremely clean and they are supplying everything you need for the week. There is now a sports bar and restaurant newly added this year. They have a limited menu, but what they fix is very good. There is an updated game room and there are now 14 heated pools on the property. The only thing we do not really enjoy is the insistance on a sale presentation every time we check in. We absolutely stead fastly dig in and refuse to go. And they will still call you in the middle of the week a couple of times and beg you to go. But, all in all they have done a very nice job at the Town Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with everything you need in one place!”
Reviews.Author: krwshl
Reviews.Content: I was worried after reading some of the reviews but wow I was impressed so don't let them scare you. No sales speech ever. Stayed in building 5900 which was very new with a great shower. Pools were heated and there were lots of hot tubs. Two pools have bars at them :-) There is a game room with very very new games, like fruit ninja ... I was shocked. Dvd plaers in room and you can rent them for 3 bucks up front. 3 restaurants onsite, short and sandals is an ok bar but service was poor. Shuttle to epcot and universal was great! Departs at 9 or 12 and comes back at 6 or 9. Make reservations at the vip desk in advance and no worries. Would no hesitate to come back, heard they are building a waterpark soon.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go on the tour!”
Reviews.Author: Klj962
Reviews.Content: Such a shame that I couldn't give this place An overall 5. Had such a great experience until we ran into the sleeze ball salesman named Pablo who tried selling us a timeshare. For such a beautiful resort it boggles my mind how they let such scum come in contact with their guests. However, besides that everything was fine. Would have brought my kids here for the next 20 years but Pablo and his slimy sales team ruined that. May or may not come back now.

Reviews.Title: “Facilities and Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: HeidiDugan
Reviews.Content: We've stayed twice in the Westgate Town Center, once in 2006 and once in 2009. Both times we were in a 1-bedroom unit (not a studio ... a full separate bedroom), once with our two kids (then 4 and 7) and once without. Westgate Town Center is clean and spacious, both the grounds in general and the unit, itself. We used the pool, but didn't make use of any of the other resort facilities. We were in orlando for Disney World and that's where we spent our time. As for the timeshare pitch: We are not owners, but my MIL is and we used her weeks. One our first visit we attended the "owner's breakfast" and were pitched buying additional time. We made it perfectly clear from the start that we had no intention of buying and we didn't feel pressured. On our second visit we were asked at check-in to schedule a breakfast meeting and we declined because "we didn't know what our schedule would be" and because we would "be spending so much time in the parks." We received one follow-up phone call voicemail, which we ignored. As for the unit: we LOVED having so much space. To be able to actually unpack all of our clothes for the week into dresser drawers and hang items in closets was priceless. Having a full kitchen, we did some minor grocery shopping and saved a ton of money by mostly eating breakfast in the timeshare each morning and by packing snacks to carry into the parks. Plus, on our non-Disney days, we cooked small meals in and enjoyed the space to relax. Sure, the decor looks like a Florida retirement community, but that's kind of the mood we expected -- teal, coral, pink, etc. The kids loved the jacuzzi (it was too cold to use the pool most days) and we stuck them in there in their swimsuits and they had a blast. Possibly the best thing about Westgate is the Location. With our kids, we left the parks each afternoon to return to the timeshare for naps. With our own rental car, we could buzz back from the parks, sleep for a couple of hours, and return to the parks. The resort is only minutes from the South entrance to the Disney property ... especially close to Disney Hollywood Studios and the Animal Kingdom. We love our time at this resort and enjoy having so much space, making use of the kitchen facilities and especially the location!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Josh3695
Reviews.Content: Ok .. this was my first attempt at a timeshare / condo thing. I purchased a week just to give it a shot and boy am i glad i didn't commit to anything long term.So before I left I had talked to a few of my friends and they warned me about the typical things to expect from "timeshares" si I called to verify any hidden costs that I might see from their past experiences. One of which was house keeping. While on the phone with the front desk the rep assured me that there was no fees to have our bed linens changed daily. We even called back and spoke to a different rep and got the same answer. So we make our trip down to this establishment and go to check in and were behind about 10 people doing the same. After about an 90 mins of watching 2 staff members muddle their way through the process and 5 staff members chatting behind the counter .. it was our turn. Got to our rooms .. which were very nice and clean and very roomy. We get up the next morning and call house keeping to discover that not only is there a charge for new sheet service .. they will not change them .. they will only deliver them to your room. So we make due with doing the laundry daily until the "complimentary cleaning" that is provided in the middle of our stay. After we arrive back to our room we discover that not only did they not change the sheets .. they didn't do anything else ... so much for a "complimentary cleaning" Then I get a phone call from the office telling me that because they have changed a lot of the perks from when I first bought my "package" that my wife and I had to come back to the office and sign some more papers so that I was informed of my new "perks". I bet that they just want to try to sell me some more of their "packages". NO THANKS!!!

Reviews.Title: “coming home”
Reviews.Author: jameshunter005
Reviews.Content: Just back from Westgate after two weeks wonderful holiday, fourth time staying there and it just keeps getting better .Great on-site facilities, really great accommodation and a shower you could spend an hour in.On a nice stretch of the 192 with in walking distance to Sizzlers for breakfast ,all you can eat for $ 4.99, a TGI Friday an Outback Steak House,Wildside for ribs and many more. A short drive to Animal Kingdom and access to all Disney Parks and about 30 to 40 mins along the I 4 to Universal,20-25 to Seaworld and a must ,is a trip into Celebration about 10 mins away, the same distance along the 192 is Kissimmee Old Town great vintage car rally on Friday nights Whole family 8 and a baby had a whale of a,time

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: Amanda O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Westgate Town Center "Hotel" which we stayed at from February 12-February 17, 2012. We booked this through a hotwire deal that you couldn't see the hotel you were booking, but it would be a hotel similar to a Hilton, Hyatt, Wyndham, Westin, or similar. We have stayed at these other hotels, so we know what this type of experience should be. After we processed our selection the Westgate Town Center Hotel came up. We had not heard of it, but we were willing to give it a try. We started to do our research, and realized it was a timeshare condo type of place. A hotel in our opinion is much different than a timeshare condo. You know what to expect at the hotel (toiletries, cleaning service, beds, etc.), at a timeshare condo (or Villa as they call it) you have no idea. I made a call to Westgate to find out a little bit more before our trip. The phone number reached an central answering service, not the front desk of the hotel. The person did not know specifics regarding the place we were staying. This was concerning, but we were still willing to give this place a try. She told me we would be booked in a "studio" (again, this is not a familiar "hotel" type of stay) and the studio had a King size bed and a couch area. I asked if we needed to bring shampoo/conditioner, towels, etc. She did not know, but put me on hold and told me that the first shampoo/conditioner would be complimentary, but we would have to supply the rest. We also saw that we would be charged a resort fee of approximately $10 per night for amenities at the resort. The listed amenities were transportation to Disney and Universal, exercise facility, VIP services, ticket desk, internet, mini mart, game room, etc. (28 amenities listed on the site). At one point, we called hotwire because we felt that this listed as a hotel was not accurate. They said there was nothing that could be done. Now on to the actual trip.... We arrived around midnight because of a late flight. **note bring your itinerary to show the gate person so you can get it. We had ours, but this could make getting access difficult.** The front desk process seemed to go smooth, but the person at the counter claimed not to know anything about any of the amenities and services and said to come back the next morning (this was after having us fill out whether we were satisfied with her attitude in some sort of survey thing they give people). Although we mentioned several times to different employees through our trip that we had never been there, nobody explained any of the amenities to us or where to find things that we had paid a "resort fee" for. She gave us our room keys and sent us on our way through the giant compound known as Westgate. We arrived at our room and upon opening the door we found that we had two beds that were maybe full size. The bedding was scratchy, the room looked outdated, there was a mocha colored weird looking blanket, a loud continuous fan sound (the air was off), and a giant window that looked right into the room from the public walkway. There was no couch area. Here is a summary of what else we experienced (off-peak season): - Unfriendly service, no information when we arrived and everyone we talked to at VIP services was rude. - Definitely not a "hotel". - Not the same caliber as a Westin, Hilton, Hyatt, etc. - Fridge was broken - Air conditioner was okay, but loud - Walls very thin - Scratchy low grade sheets (I even had a burr in my bed that poked me for 2 nights before I figured out what it was). - Resort fee never mentioned by staff. Just given a fee summary at checkout. Also, they take a $50 deposit in addition to this at the beginning of the stay for incidental. - Cleaning service did not vaccuum. Only seemed to replace towels, which were small and poor quality. Definitely did not wipe down the bathroom floor either. At least not when we were there. Maybe this is the policy. Not sure since nobody ever explained anything about this "hotel" to us. - Security staff were the friendliest out of everyone we encountered. - The transportation to the theme parks is confusing. There are limited spaces available and you have to sign up for them ahead of time (at least a whole day) at VIP services. We went and signed up and the girl did not explain where to pick up the shuttle, how to get back (when I called to verify how we get back the guy that answered kept saying "it's on the sheet". They circled the departure time, but they did not circle anything for return. There were two times listed and a bus location number, but no directions. On the bus, the driver did not explain either. We found out that you bring your sheet to your departure driver (hang on to it!) and then you bring it with you again when you want to leave and stand at the location indicated on the sheet and show it to the return driver. They will not let you on if you do not have it. - Discount tickets are only available if you are going to a park for more than 1 day. It is worth buying them from hotel though if you do not wish to stand in line at the park. In order to get the discount you will need to sit through the timeshare speech. The ticket salesperson was helpful and nice and did not make us sith through this because we were only going one day. - Pool area near our room in the 5900 building was decent. Needless to say, the experience could have been a lot better. We were told very different things and provided comparisons that were not even close. This place might be decent for families though, but not for a couple looking for an easy get away. We would not do this again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful facility matched by wonderful services and amenities”
Reviews.Author: MikenPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: This was perhaps one of the nicest places we have stayed at. The room was incredible in every way - large rooms, balcony, huge jaguzzu, full service kitchen, comfortable leather couch, and the nicest bathroom area with the greatest shower ever! Every worker on the resort (and there are lots of them) were very friendly and helpful. The food was good and they really catered towards resort owners (discounted food, etc.). we will be certain to check out all Westgate Resorts for future travel, it was that good!

Reviews.Title: “Westgate Town Centre & Vacation Villa's”
Reviews.Author: YanchikSiberia
Reviews.Content: I have been coming here for quite a few years, in fact I am still here at the moment and I think that its a brilliant place. Sometimes things are a bit funny but go to front desk & they always seem to resolve problems.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: grandmahenry
Reviews.Content: We just got home from the Westgate Town Centre and could not have been more pleased. The condo we stayed in there was huge, lovely and even had a jacuzzi for two in the bedroom - which we used a lot. The staff were lovely and helpful. We thoroughly appreciated the full kitchen with dishwasher and garbage disposal. It's close to everything, very secure and clean, clean, clean. Lots of amenities. The Shorts and Sandals cafe was good too. The downside is teh timeshare presentation, although I suspect you don not have to attend, we did and it was confusing; we went back and asked for more clarification which the staff gladly provided. We were not interested in a time share and there was no pressure. We would stay there again and recommend it to others without hesitation. We also had a view of the Disney fireworks every night.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service unless you attend seminar”
Reviews.Author: Chai T
Reviews.Content: Well, it started out nice when we got there, got to the front counter, then was told a representative was coming out to greet me. Well I didn't want to attend the breakfast/lunch seminar where they try and sell you something. They were sooo persistent that it got to a point where the person actually said 'so do you want to stay here or not?'. I won, since I still declined. After I finally got my keys and went to the room, everything was fine. The next day they cleaned my room and all was fine. The days after that though, I noticed they decided not to clean my room or change any of our towels. Hmmm..I guess if you don't go to the seminar, all the amenities cost you money..even the maid service! Not the end of the world. Just not the experience I expected.. Last but not least..my wife found a giant cockroach under her shoe in the closet..oh well. Still had a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a change since 1999”
Reviews.Author: Mike151
Reviews.Content: Back in 1999 many things went wrong including not getting the room we requested which cast a pall on the week. We also have been staying at the Marriott Grand Vista on our last 2 family (12) adventurers to Orlando. We had an extra week to use from Interval International and decided to give Westgate Town Center another chance. What a pleasant surprise. Because of delays in Atlanta we did not arrive until 2AM. We had a brief discussion about our past experience with Westgate with the front desk person along with our current reservation. He apologized for our past experience and offered an upgrade to a deluxe 1 bedroom suite for a substantial discount. We were exhausted and decided to take the offer of the upgrade. The room was everything we expected ground floor and away from the pool noise. We had a full kitchen, large granite dining table and matching kitchen counter with eating counter, comfortable living room, king size bed with a Jacuzzi tub and large walk in shower with a waterfall and hand held shower head. Our porch faced a pond and a little used back road, for the most part a nice private quiet setting Our first impression on the way to lunch was the outdoor amenities, the pond with swan paddle boats. the put put golf with prehistoric animals through out and walking paths around the pond. We had lunch at the sports bar that has a great menu and excellent drinks. We walked the perimeter of the campus every morning and noted how well maintained the grounds were. Although we never inspected the two story units we staid in in 99, we were told that they were all in the process of being renovated and updated. There were several pools in our are to pick from but stuck with one for the week. It is a free style pool with a good size hot tub with several jets. You could order lunch and have it delivered to your location anywhere on the campus. We found the resort to be in location that was easy to get to all the attractions in and around Orlando. However on this trip we were not interested in the main attractions. We did go to Universals City Walk and Downtown Disney. Of the two, Disney was the better choice for the number of restaurants and entertainment along the streets. At City walk we ate at Bob Marly's and Disney at the House of Blues and would recommend both. Then the was Joe's Crab Shack on 192 a short distance from the resort. What a fun place to dine and again a great menu and drinks. We are not owners at this resort but noticed most all the activities were free to members along with a 50% discount at the restaurants. Our best advice is to use a GPS voice direction device. We used an app on my cell phone that made it easy to get around with no hassles. Yes this trip to The Westgate Town Center changed our opinion of Westgate and probable will return with our family for our next Disney trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Westgate Town Center during the holidays. This was my second time there as an owner and my first time in a three bedroom. I was traveling with my husband and 4 children and 3 grand kids. My oldest daughter had a 1 bedroom in the new building not to far from the building that we were in. We were able to check in early and that made a big difference having the children. The place has improved so much from the last time that we visited. The children loved the bikes and the paddle boats. Being an owner does make a difference, we pay little or nothing for things. My son and his friend loved the new sports bar. My daughter took her kids to the arcade, but decided to go to Chuck E Cheese instead. The arcade is too expensive even as an owner. We had great discounts for breakfast and lunch. Owners got 50% of lunch and breakfast. I was happy with the housekeeping service. If you ask for something, it is brought to you immediately and plenty is provided. I loved the room we were in. We had a three bedroom in building 5000. It was a lock-out unit. My son had the studio unit, which was big the only thing it didn't have was a full kitchen. The two-bedroom had full kitchen with lots and lots of space. My daughter and her husband enjoyed the property so much that they are considering buying.

Reviews.Title: “Does not measure up to other Orlando/attraction area resorts”
Reviews.Author: 120nativeFL
Reviews.Content: I booked reservation here through DreamVacations.com, more specifically Condos Direct. I got the 2bdrm for $400+ for a seven night stay. Upon visiting direct website for Westgate Towncenter I saw there was a standard 2bdrm, and a deluxe 2bdrm. Of course deluxe was much nicer, 1200+ sq.ft versus 690 sq.ft for standard. Deluxe had larger kitchen with updated stainless steel appliances, and much nicer furnishings. I called resort directly to confirm reservation, I also asked about possibility to get an upgrade to a deluxe 2bdrm, and how much that would cost. (I was more than willing to pay a reasonable amount for upgrade) Clerk told me she was unable to do that herself, but she would make a note of it in reservation, and if upgrade was available, it would be furnished at no extra charge. Upon arriving at resort, you pass by Westgate Vacation Villas, which look like they have been around since the seventies, granted Towncenter more modern, but maybe eighties, nineties- more modern. When I checked in, asked clerk if I got the upgrade, she looked through reservation, smiled, and said "you got it". Upon arriving at room noticed immediately that it was standard room, not deluxe. I called to front desk, and said I was told I would be in a deluxe room, clerk replied, in not a great tone, "did I pay for an upgrade" I explained process from confirmation, to check in, and what I was told by two representatives from resort. She placed me on hold to investigate, when she came back on line, she said she did not know why front desk clerk told me that. I could not receive an upgrade, because none were available. Again tone of this person was dismissive, and condescending. I said thank you, and goodbye, and hung up, knowing I would get nowhere with this person. I did not pursue it, as I should have. My thinking was, Westgate clearly is in error, let them step up and acknowledge the mistake, and make good on it. They never did. That one incident soured the whole week stay. I was in building 5500, sixth floor. View was of lake/swamp depending on how you look at it. Ugly power lines, and a road with frequent, and load traffic noise. Plus and minus of the unit: PLUS: Very comfy bed in master bdrm Very nice shower in master bdrm large balcony, nicely furnished granite surfaces throughout MINUS: uncomfortable "pleather" sofa in living room kitchen appliances outdated-dishwasher looked antique, and so loud no coffee mugs ceramic tile throughout living area, had grout so dirty that it was completely black in many areas toilet in hall bathroom continuously clogged clothes dryer controls did not work properly horrible view(see above decor outdated-other reviewer here said "golden girls" that summed it up quite good Resort grounds were adequate, but could have been so much nicer. Pools were basic, 13, I believe they had. Better to do one spectacular pool, instead of 13 basic. Saw sign for proposed water park, looked promising. I cannot get over not getting upgrade to deluxe unit. If clerk told me upgrade was granted, then grant it. If clerk truly was in error, then offer SOMETHING to make up for her error. Hard to believe though that no deluxe units available, since resort was fairly deserted during my stay 1/07/12-1/14/12. Just an inexcusable failure on Westgates part. In summary, too much of this resort is outdated, and it looks it. There are SO MANY resorts in Orlando/attractions area. Why settle for this?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Dominica_11
Reviews.Content: We spend a vacation week in Westgate Town Center and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. After reading all the negative reviewes we were hesitant to stay here but I am soo glad we did! The location is great, only 10-15 min. drive to the Disney Parks. ( rental car is a MUST). The property is huge with tons of activities a beautiful lake, game room, several restaurants, bars, shops, spa, 14 pools (all were clean and well maintained). Near the resort we found Sizzler's with all you can eat buffet breakfast for $3.99 per person ( get coupon in resort's comp. magazine). We were checking in a little after 6 p.m. and it took us no more than 10 min. We were escorted to the Resort representative who quickly explained the benefits of attending presentations. We knew far ahead that we were not interested in attending and after saying "No ,Thank you" we were never bugged again. We asked the girl at the desk for a higher floor and were given the unit on the 8th level, one bedroom ,spacious and clean. We loved the large balcony and jacuzzi tub in the bedroom. Large flat screen tvs in both bedroom and living room. Rainforest shower, plenty of towels. Fully supplied kitchen and large fridge, washing machine and dryer. Overall the unit acceded our expectations and had a great value, since we got a special timeshare exchange rate. I would reccomend this resort to anyone and when we go back to Orlando this will be our first choice place to stay. Thank you Westgate Town Center.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: Pam T
Reviews.Content: A few months ago we stayed at Marriotts Grande Vista, and even as a devotee of that chain, I have to say Westgate won me over. Our 1 br deluxe villa is huge, nicely decorated, with high end finishes and amenities. Just being left several packs of detergent for the full size stacked laundry is something that makes traveling light easier, and it's the little things that make or break a vacation. Reading other reviews, I agree that our sleepy, jet lagged brains were jarred a bit by the immediate offer of a timeshare sales presentation when we first checked in. This is a well-oilers machine and you are definitely channeled past checkin to sales. But if you put on your big people panties and say NO THANK YOU, you can bypass all that and be taken by or follow a little tram where a pleasant young person escorts you through the maze of buildings to your room or suite and gets you settled. Very nice. Our suite is immaculate with tiled floors in living areas warmed up with tropical colors and rugs, the kitchen and bath have marble counters, there is a huge dining table perfect for planning a days activities (we always feel like an invading army, with our maps, coupons, and local papers, comparing attractions). The tub is big enough for two and then some and has color changing waterfall fillers and bubblers. A large separate shower and dressing room makes easy to all get ready at once. One way Westgate outshines Marriott is in the activities. There are many to choose from and the only challenge is that the place is so big it took us a while to figure out where various things were. No, we didn't ask, but should have as we missed some fun things like making a stuffed flamingo (I thought that would be a cheesy thing for little kids but the results, which we saw at the activities building, we're comparable to build a bear) and tie dying a t shirt. We did play their mini golf course which was just challenging enough to be fun but easy enough to allow for each of us to get a hole in one at some point. It winds around a lake with paddle boats and swan boats so it's scenic and relaxing too. You can rent bikes there as well We weren't in love with the breakfast buffet at Shorts and Sandals, some things were cold, but it was okay and convenient. The local grocery/gift shop is well stocked and, with a call prior to arrival, will stock your kitchen from your list at prices that aren't outrageous, something harried parents traveling with little ones should consider so they don't waste their first theme park day at Publix. What we thought was a problem with our shower turned out to be operator error. You pull out on the faucet and then have the option of standard, rainshower, or both. Once we reported it, they took care of it (pleasantly showed us how to use it). Only other issue was that the pool was too cool to my liking. The one by our building (there are 14 ) was mostly in shade and a kid told us it was cold. That was enough to keep me out. Summer months are probably fine. Full disclosure...we did buy here. Not at full price, but a deeply discounted unit in the older Villas area (we stayed in the newest building in Town Center). We will be back each March for spring training games and ESPN park is just down the road. The Braves train there so we will see our beloved Tigers training games when they are there and not have to drive to Lakeland. The resort is pet friendly and you see occasional dogs being walked, but I never heard barking or any of the sounds you might expect from so many people nearby. Lovely resort with lots to do (as owners, mini golf, boats, bikes and much more are free; minimal fee for non owners) or do as little as possible. We will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful family-friendly resort but heavy time-share sales pitch”
Reviews.Author: dohligee
Reviews.Content: This resort is ideally located, just off of Rt 192 about a mile from Disney World. The property is beautifully landscaped and well-maintained. The Town Center buildings are newer and the suites are large, clean and provide plenty of storage. There are numerous pools and other amenities at the resort, which we did not take advantage of. We did have dinner in the sports bar and found it to be a relatively good value. The main problem we have with this resort is their super high pressure time share pitch. We had to meet with, no less than 4 staff members before we were finally able to check in and get assigned a room. Each person had their own sales pitch and were so nice and smooth about it that we were signed up for the presentation before we knew it. We're seasoned travelers (and own several timeshares, tho not this one) so should have known better. I got sold by the free breakfast (ok, I was hungry when we checked in, so any mention of food got my attention!). The presentation the next day was very high pressure and we, again, had to speak with a procession of at least 4 more staff members who did not like hearing that we were not going to buy. My suggestion is Just Say No to all offers and avoid the sales pitch at all costs. The freebies they give you are not worth your time! We wasted an entire morning for a mediocre breakfast and a couple of discount coupons. The other problem we had was excessively long waits at the front gate - there were invariably a large number of cars lined up to get through the security gate, and the guards took their time letting people through. Even if you went to the gate that required only a room key, the back up was often very long. Overall, if you avoid the sales pitches, this is a great place to stay if you're going to Disney World, as it's very easy access to and from the parks. The property is very large, gated with secured entry, and easy to navigate. If you do have kids, there are numerous activities available onsite, and the spacious suites provide a full kitchen, including laundry. Internet is available, but not free.

Reviews.Title: “Westgate town center - had cockroach in the room-”
Reviews.Author: help50
Reviews.Content: Checking in process ok but went to our unit and only there 5 minutes and a cockroach crawled across the dresser. We had a good response from the cleaning lady (suggested we move rooms) but VIP services did not feel the same. THey did not see a problem with staying in the room even though they were going to spray the next day. (they said the spray was orderless!) Finally got a new room. (no compensation for the inconvience.) Another issue was the whirlpool tub. It took 3 calls to get someone up to fix it as it would not work. There was also a leak above the hot tub. (tub leaking above us). Our biggest issue was we were assured that we only need to say we were not interested in buying a time share. (we purchased a vacation week and had already done a tour.) We were over 2 hours telling them NO! They even showed us a nice unit which made the experience more frustrating. We never used the pool as it was a ways from the unit we were in.
