(4000) On a postive note, the unit was clean and not sure why there was a cockroach. I would discourage anyone from staying here. They were dishonest with us and not the kind of service you want for your vacation...not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “good alternative close to disney parks”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare property that rents rooms as well, which means there are some special considerations when chosing this company. PROS: the property is gated and controlled by a guard and keycard, which offers at least some semblence of extra safety, and at the very least, makes it a bit quieter even though it is a large property with multiple buildings, it never felt croweded, even the week of christmass - one of the busiest times of the year in Orlando the "heated" pools were actually a very nice temperature multiple pools around the property rooms have kitchens - very helpful for keeping dining out costs down very close to irlo brunson pkwy - whch has many stores/restaraunts/gas the traffic flow and driving time to disney was great - less than 15 min with no traffic problems free minigolf and paddle boats lots of onsite activities (did not participate - spent time at Disney- but looked interesting) the cost (via hotwire) was very affordable very quiet CONS the timeshare pitches check in is slow (also due to sales pitch) all in all, i'd stay here again, and i'd make some time to enjoy the properties amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Recent stay week of Dec 11,2011”
Reviews.Author: Tommy745
Reviews.Content: Pretty good vacation place. It is a timeshare. Clean and well maintained plus very close to WD parks

Reviews.Title: “An extended family vacation”
Reviews.Author: MIkkinJay
Reviews.Content: This was a return trip for us to Westgate... we stayed there in 2004 also. We did a timeshare exchange to get a 3 bedroom unit. We stayed in building 5600. This unit was almost identical to the one we stayed at in 2004 and we enjoyed it as much. There are many mixed reviews on here so hopefully this will help people. Our group staying here was myself, husband, 26yr old son, 17 and 16 yr old daughters... we were meeting up with my 24 yr old daughter (she and her husband, 2 children and his sister and parents stayed on disney property) First, I have read about people getting less than friendly service at check in..we were excited to get to the resort after so long and I went in all smiles...yes, I was asked my name by three people (all of them smiled at me and forwarded me where I needed to go)...once I reached the desk (very quickly) I was helped promptly! I mention this because the woman who came in after me made a snappy comment to one of the ladies asking her name " I've already given it three times!!" and gave attitude. Now, it was true that we were asked that many times but this is a resort that has many venues... I could have simply booked a room, I could have bought a getaway, or I could have exchanged (which was the case). It stands to reason that there are many reason, including security, that you could be directed differently depending on how you were there. This woman did not have the happy experience that I had because she was not a happy person. Grumpy people make it hard to be friendly...just sayin... I declined the "breakfast"/sales event and was not pressured. The bell person was great and helped us take our luggage in. Our room was clean, and exactly as I expected with only a couple small quirks. 1. there was no fan adjustment in the bigger part of the unit (this really bothered my husband) 2. the dishwasher cleaned really crappy...it left a heavy film on the dishes and we ended up washing them by hand. not a big deal but could be to some. The great: there were a ton of towels... plenty of pillows...nice deck furniture... a full size coffee pot... washer/dryer unit...ice machine worked great...lots of space!!...very close to disney. The kids used the pool and found it to be great. They do not enforce the pool closing time which I find great for teens coming back after the parks all day. The only room that was really noisy was the girls room that was right across from the elevator and it did sound like people were in the room with you. After walking all day and then a swim they usually slept with no issues. There is plenty of water pressure and we never ran out of hot water. We went to a walmart (within 10 miles) because the local stores are pretty pricey. The activities are expensive! about $9 per person per time if you don't go to the sales show. we got the wifi for the week $39.95...(for ONE piece of equipment) we only used one laptop and it worked out fine... we were told that the McDonald's up the street does have free wifi, but we were fine with the fee...if the credit card you leave at check-in is a debit they hold $50 for the week, but you can apply your wifi bill to that. If you are using this place as a sleeping stop while enjoying florida it is great!! If you are going here for the "resort" itself it might not measure up to all that you are looking for... we would stay again...its clean with a great kitchen and laundry in unit making for a happy Mom. :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Marti E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I selected this property because it is affiliated with Westgate Vacation Villas. We stayed there 10 years ago and had a positive experience. This stay was pretty much the opposite. After a long drive, we arrived around 9:30 p.m. We did not make it to our room until about an hour later. The check in process was complicated for no reason. First someone prepared our keys, then we were passed off to a concierge-type individual who pressured us to commit to attending a breakfast to get "VIP" (owner) benefits. We were then passed on to two (2) additional individuals before actually being taken to our room. We declined the breakfast, not wanting to lose valuable vacation time as we weren't interested in purchasing an additional time share. However, this is the only property where I have been an exchanging owner and was treated any differently than a property owner (and did not get the same privileges, access and perks) and that was disappointing. Our room was on the first floor of the "town hall" building where check-in and plenty of other activity occurs. While that limited our ability to relax, we also were called one evening at 10:45 p.m. by the on-site pizza shop three (3) times in a five minute period to see if we'd ordered a pizza. We indicated we had not, yet they kept calling. There are doorbells on the units which are appealing to small children and were frequently rung. The walls were paper thin and we could here the guests in the adjoining unit talk and eat. Every night at midnight, the sprinklers outside our unit came on. Other than the bathroom, the set-up of the condo appears cheap. The televisions are the tube-style, the appliances are bottom-shelf KMart brand, the pullout couch is made of pleather, and the bedroom is appointed in decor that was en vogue in the late 1980's and early 1990's. The thermostat is programmed for cost-savings and would not stay at the slightly lower temperature we wanted, which made sleeping uncomfortable. We did not receive any housekeeping during the week. Apparently this, like other amenities one takes for granted at a 'resort', is at an extra cost. Again, I've not encountered this at any of the other dozen or so Interval International resorts where I've stayed in the last decade. I've always received at least one housekeeping visit, about midway through the week. We left a day early and went to stay with my sister on the Gulf Coast. When my husband opened his suitcase to get his pajamas, a large cockroach came flying out of the bag, an unwelcome souvenir from Westgate.

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative to the parks for families”
Reviews.Author: poohkin
Reviews.Content: My in-laws are owners here so we were given a week to stay in a 3 bedroom. The good: About 10 mins to the Disney parks. Very convenient. You have to rent a car or drive your own but it is really close to everything. The newer units are very comfortable, decorated well and great for families. We had plenty of room and space for our large group. It's great to have a full kitchen to eat meals versus going out to eat all the time. And so nice to do laundry on a regular basis. The bad: Get ready for a sales pitch. My in laws own 5 units and we still are hounded to sit through a pitch when we arrive and at least once during our stay. If you're not in a newer unit, the rooms are very outdated. They look like the Golden Girls' house in 1989. The service is not great. When we checked in, someone drove us to our tower, but didn't help with bags at all and there were no luggage carts to be found. Not a great experience for owners who traveled all day. They have been slow to make updates nd changes. We were sold on new restaurants, water slides and conveniences. Little has been updated in the 4 years we've been going. Lots of talk, little action. Overall, we like how comfortable we are when we stay at a newer unit. The rooms are gorgeous and it's great to have a home away from home when traveling with family. It's close to he parks and a great plce to relax in the hot tub after walking all day.

Reviews.Title: “I am back again!!”
Reviews.Author: sonicma
Reviews.Content: Well everybody knows about my review in July yeah well if westgate sent you a sorry note don't listen to it they just want you to feel better about and come back and give them more money they do not care about your service or anything they care about the money and that's why they hired all those foreign people so that when you tried to complain to them they do the "I no speak English" on you I would recommend the other westgate the one before you get to this one thanks for your time!!! :-) :-(

Reviews.Title: “Getting better!”
Reviews.Author: bearpawqs
Reviews.Content: We are owners who stay once a year. Our stay this year was better than most. We do find the facilities to be well maintained and clean. We were also treated very well by the staff. I must say though that the sales department does not take no for an answer. As owners we are not obligated to attend the owners breakfast where we are "updated" on changes they want to tell us about. Word of warning, this is the hook to get you to listen to the same 90 minutes spiel about buying more! We go during the off season so the check in process is usually fairly quick. I would much prefer to just get my key and go to the unit. We have been there long enough and we know where we are going. We don't need someone to take us to the unit and turn the lights on and off and leave without so much as two words. We also don't need to stop at all those stations and get a welcome packet of brochures we typically just throw out. For first or second timers this is a great service but for us lifers please make it stop! Another word of caution is that in the Town Center buildings there is absolutely no insulation between the units on each side of you or above you. So you can hear every conversation, fight, fart, banging cabinets, and EVERY flushing toilet! The buildings must have been built as cheaply as possible so be warned, if you get noisy neighbors next to you or above you you will hear everything. Specially the whiny, crabby, crying children. You can bet a herd of elephants will be in the unit above you too! Another observation I have made and have seen no improvement on is the fact that pedestrians simply do not have the right of way at Westgate. The place is simply overrun with golf carts. They do not respect the pedestrians. I was almost hit several times. So watch your kids! It sure would be nice if they had at least one of the 14 pools designated as an adult pool, no kids, and no throwing things. Don't get me wrong, it's great to see families having fun together but when they are throwing footballs and frisbees from one end of the pool to the other it is very difficult for others to also enjoy the pool. The vast majority of people sure don't have very good throwing arms! lol. So again, be advised if you are not one of those families who take over the whole pool, find one of the lesser used ones. If Westgate should read this review, please figure out a way to have recycling stations where we can drop of our cans, glass, and plastic recyclables. You also need to have channel guides in your welcome packet or in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start with a great finish”
Reviews.Author: DraacoPendragon
Reviews.Content: 3 Years ago a friend and I went to a timeshare presentation at the Westgate Town Center, "Taking one for the team" to get some cheap tickets to Universal. I rejected all of the offers except the last which was very reasonable, a well priced 1BR Villa vacation package with payments over time...I made my reservations and paid the extra $200 for a two bedroom villa so that my father and his best friend could come down as well (he needed a vaca in the worst way) So here's the goods: DO NOT, if at all possible, stay in the older section of villas unless your #1 priority is the 25% more privacy. When I went on the tour they showed me the Town Center rooms (the high rise looking over Disney property). When checking in I was given an older 2BR villa they said was newly renovated with several problems (thermostat broken, lights crooked on the walls, handles from furniture broken or missing...) I was in "Here we go" mode, so I called the front desk and asked to be moved to a different property, not expecting much. I was pleasantly surprised at the quick response, and the gentleman who assisted me was very helpful. He showed me 3 different possibilities, all of which were nice, but the one we settled on was the exact room we had toured 3 years ago...from then on it was all thumbs up. The 5th floor high rise villa was fresh, well decorated, and very open (I'm a huge fan of open floor plans). Smaller but well furnished kitchen, mid sized balcony with a table and chairs (View was the best in the place tho phone lines took a bit away from what would otherwise be very nice), and a perfect sized living room with a large sectional and television. Master bedroom was a real treat. King size bed, mirrors everywhere, a large hot tub, dual head shower, 2 sinks, and an entrance to the balcony. Only downside was a very small toilet room. Lighting in the bedroom was on the "mood lighting" side, not incredibly bright, but sufficient. Second bedroom had 2 Full size beds, good view of the property, its own TV, and a very nice little shower/bathroom combo. Separate in-ceiling lights for both beds as well. The property is fairly large, featuring 13 pools (which were dead as it was off-season), a few places to eat, and tennis/volleyball/basketball courts. Each building has a pool nearby so you don't need to walk far if you want to swim or hop in the jacuzzi. The food, from two restaurants that we sampled (Having the vacation package entitled us to be "Owners" for the week and as such we had a large discount on meals and activities, some of which were free) was very mediocre so we decided not to eat on property. There were various activities that we did not participate in such as crafts, a Dinosaur themed mini golf that was very low skill level but a nice diversion for kids and families, catch and release fishing, paddle-boats, and more. Again, it was off-season so there wasn't much traffic at the resort in general. The resort is very close to Disney, but offers very little in terms of transportation, so if you want to make your own schedule, you will want to plan on driving or getting a cab anywhere you want to go. The shuttle service to Disney, for example, had one bus leaving in the morning which you had to register for. The returning bus could only be used by those who used it in the morning and still only had one departure time at night. Wrapped up...The properties in the high rise buildings are great, activities to suck up down time for the family abound, food is mediocre, staff is there to help, and make sure you plan on doing most of the driving!

Reviews.Title: “Great, kid friendly resort”
Reviews.Author: aswiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over spring break for a week with our kids and another family. My friends own a time share with a lockout and we stayed with them in the lockout. All together we had 11 people staying at the condo and did not feel the least bit crowded. The lockout was a good size with one bedroom, a living room with a pull out bed, a small breakfast nook and a kitchenette (fridge, toaster, microwave, coffee pot). There was also a bedroom with a queen size bed and a bathroom with a wirlpool. The main part of the condo was 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, a living room with a wrap around couch that pulls out into a king size bed and a full kitchen. There was even a washer and dryer. The ammenities of the resort were very nice. There was a movie theatre and put put golf to entertain the kids as well as bikes, paddle boats and a pool. Over all this was a great place, especially for a family vacation. It was also relatively close to disney and seaworld.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money”
Reviews.Author: citygirl_beachlover
Reviews.Content: Just visited there with friends. I am a modest person and very down to earth so I tend to not complain about the usual stuff most travelers complain about such as "not so fluffy down comforters". With that said let me begin, first of all, the service was less than satisfactory. The people at the front desk and sales reps were so friendly until they got what they wanted from my friends who own a timeshare there. Once they upgraded their timeshare, the service quickly changed and we got an attitude from everyone we tried to get assistance from. Now let me tell you about the resort. It is not the worst but certainly not the best and for the price they are asking you would think that the pools and hot tubs would be clean. That was not the case as they were not only outdated but dirty. Also, last but not least, I had 3 gigantic roaches in my room on separate occasions, one of which ran over my foot (yeah gross!). Do yourself a favor and save your money for a better resort!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsiderate and terrible service!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sonicma
Reviews.Content: Now I just went to Westgate town center for a week with my family in July I was suppose to get a two bedroom one of the newest villas so I am checking in and they give me room CD so I get to my room and little did I know it was two seperate units so we are suspecting it is right but then we realize that we asked for 2 bedroom so we called the front office and we asked told them that we were suppose to get 2 bedroom and then they said to call back the next day so I did and then they said they would let me know what time the room was ready guess wat they called us 8:00 clock that night when they told us it wont be after 8:00 clock that night so they sent a fake representative and we tried to tell her that 16 hours from Baltimore is a dreadful and we were destined to have a great time I had to go through all of this crap so we couldn't get our money back so they gave a 2 day and 3 night I said wat the heck how is that gonna help I want a room so since we were friends we had to sleep in the same bed which was weird I would NOT recommend they rip people and they want to lie about EVERYTHING hence I had documentation of two bedroom on my reservation form so hell no!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: Biazinha2
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place I've ever stayed. Here is why I am saying this: 1. Check in took more than 2 hours. 2. At the sales presentation the sales manager called me a liar when I wouldn't buy. Also, the 90 minute presentation turned into a 3 hour session. 3. There is a common entry between two rooms. I was locked out and it took 2 hours to get me into my room. This was at 1am! 4. My laundry was stolen from the dryer in my unit! When I called security they said "what do you want me to do about it." This review is based on 4 days. I still have 3 more to go...

Reviews.Title: “So good we bought!”
Reviews.Author: ELAINE B
Reviews.Content: We first went here in 2008 on a timeshare tour so we could get reduced price tickets at the parks and shows. We loved the place as it had all the individual luxury we enjoy-washer/dryer/walk in showers/full kitchen/ 16 swimming pools/ jacuzzi tub etc. and ended up buying. Go for the tour but do not be pressured into buying-the price drops if you hold out. It is worth the cost though if you add up the price of a week's holiday here compared with the timeshare deal, which you then have for ever (to pass on in a will) to use every year or exchange to any other Westgate property. It is only a couple of miles from the Disney parks and approx half mile from shops, restaurants etc. The only problem we ever seem to have is the check in process, which takes for ever to get to the front of the queue and you are then passed along a "conveyor belt" of people all trying to get you to come to the free breakfast which is the time share sell. My word of advice is NEVER do this breakfast the day after you arrive as you need to be fully rested to understand the selling patter that they bamboozle you with. It is worth a couple of hours of your time to get the discounted park tickets but say you will come around day 3/4 of your stay. A great stay every time and because of the washer and dryer you need not pack half as many clothes, leaving space for souvenirs. A spa is meant to be opening (in 2009!!) but in the meantime this service is available at Westgate Lakes which is a few miles up the road. You definitely need a car as nothing is walkable, even for the fittest person, but this is standard for wherever you stay in Florida. It also allows exploration further afield and I highly recommend the towns of Celebration and Jacksonville and the shopping malls around an hour's drive away. You will not be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great time with friends”
Reviews.Author: Millport18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an upgraded apartment - one bedroom with a small kitchen area and a sleeper sofa in the small lounge area. Very clean and you are provided with plenty of soap, shampoo, washing powder and even dishwasher powder as well. Usual large american bed and good TVs in the bedroom and lounge. The room connected through to the next room, which was also one bed but much larger with a jacuzzi bath and a balcony area. Very useful feature for two families. The sofa bed, although it looked good had a terrible mattress - the same was true of the sofa bed in the room next door - you could feel the springs popping through. 13 or 14 swimming pools dotted around so you could always fiind a reasonably quiet one. The first one we visited had poor water quality but the others were fine. There is a shop on site but it was expensive compared to the stores off site. However, we enjoyed ourselves here and would come back and it was definitely value for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Room was nice but wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: neoncactus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our second week in Orlando after staying at the Marriott Grande Vista. Initial check in was smooth, but then instead of just giving me the keys to our unit, a map and a list of the activities, they made me wait for about five minutes for another representative. That representative then tried to get me to a timeshare breakfast presentation. I was told if I went, we could get a card that gave us free access to the property amenities. If I wanted to make an open ended reservation, they wanted a $20 deposit. We had the week planned at Disney, so the extra property amenities really weren't going to be used anyway, so I declined. However, the whole way they do the check in started the week off on the wrong foot. I got our check in packet from her and then we finally went to our unit. The unit itself was nice, it was a 2 bedroom. The only problem we encountered was a lack of hot water. They had maintenance come and fix the issue and everything else was nice. The resort is huge, they have a lot to do, but we never used their pools or took advantage of the movies, mini golf or restaurants on property. The area around it seems a bit run-down, with a lot of discount ticket sellers. They have a lot of activities but there seem to be costs associated with most of them. After coming from the Marriott, where they included many of their activities at no extra charge, it was a turn off. One thing I did like was that coming out of the resort, it was a direct shot into Disney World near Animal Kingdom and we could avoid Hwy 192 traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Easter weekend with the Team”
Reviews.Author: WallySWFlorida
Reviews.Content: Traveled to play the "Easter Classic" Basketball tournament . There were 5 families, we had a variety of room types, one being a 4 bedroom, that ended up being the absolute meeting ,eating, and party site. The facility was all quality, all the families loved the whole experience!! We went back in June and it was equally as good!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Experence Ever”
Reviews.Author: PerezMom
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant about this vacation. Never stayed in a time share resort but from the very beginning it was lovely. The staff was great, the room was spectacular (better than any Disney Resort). The time share presentation was basically a comedy show and no pressure at all. I wish I had the money to buy because this place is A++. The room was huge, clean, lovely, had everything you could possibly imagine. Saved a lot on eating out. We got the VIP package for $50 more and rode bikes, paddle boats, fishing, miniature golf for free. They have so much stuff to do you don't have to leave the facility. very close to all the parks. Stay there you will love it......

Reviews.Title: “Great space”
Reviews.Author: Mesha4u2011
Reviews.Content: Nice 3bdr room condo. Cant beat that price for what you get. It costs us about 550 for 6 days! 3bdr 3bath 2living rooms, 2kitchens, 2balconies, 2jacuzzis, standup shower, washer/dryr, great water view, close to disney, alot onsite, need more????

Reviews.Title: “Villas at Westgate Resort were perfect for team and family”
Reviews.Author: tni
Reviews.Content: We were in Kissimmee for a week-long basketball tournament and had 4 one-bedroom villas in building MMM. We were with owners and experienced their amenities free of charge. The villas were perfect for our stay. The villas were spacious and had everything we needed. We cooked up to 3 meals a day and utilized their pots and pans and dishes. We shopped between Sams, Wal-Mart and Target. Just remember to bring seasonings, cooking oil, etc in addition to the food. I didnt require any additional pans or other kitchen utensils other than what they provided. We made it work. The washer and dryer were extremely convenient and used daily with no issues. Beds were comfortable and plenty of linens and pillows were available. We were replenished with new towels daily, which I didn't expect in a villa rental. Wi-fi was also good with one access point in the center of each building. Weekly access was $40 for guests. The rest of the resort was conducive for family vacations. Plenty of pools with warm hot tubs. (Pool towels provided in the villa). We used the BBQ grills a couple of times. Tried the paddle boats which my kids enjoyed. The movie theater was nice and golf looked fun. We utilized the basketball courts a lot and they stayed pretty full. Kids loved the game room. All in all, a convenient resort. We utilized the villas like our second home and it fit the bill. The resort provided the nice extras that we took advantage of in our spare time. Location was great off 192 and close to food, shopping, and amusement parks. The reason I don't give this a 5 is because of check-in. Check-in is at 4 but they didn't have all villas ready by then. One of them wasn't ready until 7. This should be better managed and could've been a serious inconvenience if we would've had plans the evening we arrived. After 10 hours on the road, most families would not be happy with waiting 3 hours past check-in time...especially when most of us hope to check-in early. This is apparently a commonality there. Do NOT plan for an early check-in here! After that fiasco, we dealt little with any additional customer service and were left with our villa, which was great. We are considering coming back next year if we don't rent a large vacation home.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: disneyO8
Reviews.Content: We arrived In Florida early and decided to go to the resort to see if we could get early check in. When we got there we were told to come back at one because our room was not ready. We left to go to Sea World and came back around five to check in. After my wife waited 20 minutes to check in, she was shuttled from station to station and was pressured to sign up for the resort tour for $20 bucks. ARE YOU KIDDING ME. THEY WANT YOU TO PAY FOR A SALES TOUR. We were so mad. How can they expect to gain new members by CHARGING them $20.00 for their tour. We were told that both adults needed to attend the tour, so that was our out, I REFUSED TO GO so we just blew it off. Now here is the good news if you did go on the tour, they offered the following, Free breakfast, barbeque lunch, use of the bicycles onsite, use of the swan boats and free mini golf. All nice perks but the catch here is the swan boats looked like they were going to sink, the mini golf was something from the eighties, the bikes looked like something they pulled out of the junkyard and as far as the breakfast and b-bq, well I could only imagine. Oh and the Thomas the Train look-a-like has gotta go. We always have gone to Disney and usually stay onsite, so we knew this experience was going to be a major drop-off. This was our first timeshare experience and to say the least it may have been our last. Or not, we were so angry at their sales tactics we decided to go on the Disney Vacation Club tour to see how they approach potential client/new owners. They never asked for anything money wise, they gave us a tour that would knock your socks off and when the tour ended they gave us all ice cream, a family photo and a $75.00 gift card to use at any Disney location. So dinner at the Rainforest that night was on them. That is how it's done Westgate. We were so impressed that we ended up buying a time share with DISNEY. Not something we had expected to do. We usually like to split up our day by spending time at the pool. NOT AT THIS PLACE. The pool area was over crowded, mainly because the pool was way too small for the amount of people using it. So we never swam on our trip. (except at Discovery Cove, which I highly recommend). The good, the one bedroom we had was nice and clean. Our location on the bottom floor, corner room was good (no stairs to climb) and quiet. The linens were clean but the blankets were a little scary. We almost went to Target to get our own but we got over it and made it through the week. The grounds were nice and well maintained. When we needed help with a issue with the safe they responded quickly and the same goes for when we needed towels and TP. My advise, DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU EXPECT 5 STAR AS THEY CLAIM TO BE!!! 3 STAR AT BEST.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: kelnron05
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week the 1st week of June. We stayed in the 5600 building in a 3 bedroom lock-off. We were a little mislead by the room description so we were a bit disappointed when we arrived. The 1 bedroom lock-off portion did not have a full kitchen, washer/dryer as stated on the phone nor was there a balcony in the 1 bedroom. This was very disappointing to both families that were traveling. The 1 bedroom family had to keep coming into our room to use the balcony. We had no problems with that, but there were not enough chairs and sometimes we all couldn't sit out there. We were a party of 9 and did use the balcony often. Sometimes we just wanted some time with our own family and we couldn't, nor could they. I don't blame Westgate for this, it clearly was the representive selling the room to us for his commission. I will say this is the 4th timeshare presentation we have stayed in the last few years. We went to Westgate knowing we were planning on purchasing a timeshare this time. We travel a lot and this works for us. We went in knowing that Westgate has the worst reputation for high salesman pitches! However, they were no different then any other timeshare presentation we have been on. Our sales guy was great and not at all high pressure! We did purchase, mostly due to the low cost and for the bonus weeks. The owner rooms we were showed were 100X nicer then the one we currently were in. As for the room it was decent. It was clean, full size washer and dryer which was nice. I will say even though the room was nice, it was a tad dated comparing it to the other resorts we had visited in the past few years ... Orange Lake, Mystic Dunes and Vistana. All 3 of those hotels were much nicer. But with that being said, Westgate was still nice. The worst part of our room is that we were outside pool 13 and it was SOOOO loud! One night I called security at 11am and then again at midnight. It was just unbearable. I was annoyed no one came the 1st time and I had to wait an hour for security to show up. Pools on that particular day closed at 10pm. There is a Thomas the Train that circles the property during the day giving rides. The kids are big Thomas fans so that was a pleasant surprise! We used it to go to the overpriced market too. A nice bonus. There a lot of activities on site. We did do several of those and enjoyed it. We did the free owners BBQ one afternoon and it was packed but the line moved quickly and it was good for a free, fast meal. They also served FREE Coke, Lemonade, Water and Beer from 12-2pm. We also did the owners breakfast (both at pool 13) the morning we left. The kids enjoyed it. I would recommend this resort. Go and enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: aysawyer
Reviews.Content: My family visited the Westgate Town Center the first week of April. We had a wonderful time! Our rooms were on the ground floor which was very convenient because we had six children in our party. They enjoyed all of the amenities. We were not owners at the time we visited but decided to purchase because of the great experience. Looking forward to our next vacation. The representative who worked with us was awesome! We have kept in contact with her to schedule our Getaways.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: wdwfan10
Reviews.Content: First the good-the resort is beautiful, rooms are newly updated, clean, nicely furnished. The bed was very comfortable. Flat screen TV's. Kitchenette w/ full fridge, dishwasher, washer/dryer. One of the rooms we were in had a large shower with double shower head. Plush linens. Several pools on property and lots of amenities. There is a mini golf course, paddle boats, swan boats, gofl course, restaraunts. The bad--this is a timeshare resort. It took us one hour just to check-in. There were literally hundreds of people in the lobby, which is massive, with several different desks and areas where they try to talk you into signing up for a timeshare sales pitch. I actually booked my room last minute via a secret deal with Travelocity, so I didn't know what I was getting myself into, which I will never do again after this trip. We waited in line for about 40 minutes, then when it was our turn at the desk, they couldn't locate our reservation from Travelocity, so we had to wait another 15 minutes for them to find it. We were given a room that was only part of a larger suite, and doors leading to the other part of the suite (which was occupied by another family) were unlocked. We knocked on one door to let them know, and as we were explaining to the gentlemen that the door wasn't locked, a lady from his party walked into our room from another door that led into our bathroom. This door had been locked on our side, so that we couldn't open it, but it was the door to the toilet, so our "room" did not have access to a toilet. The man also told us that they had been in our room b/c they had been told that they had the entire set of rooms. We called to let the front desk know that our room was not secure from the larger part of the suite, then called back to tell them about the lack of toilet. We were placed on hold for over 10 minutes, so we went back to the front desk (which is quite a distance away) and they switched our rooms. All of this took approximately 2 hours out of our one night trip.

Reviews.Title: “angry owner”
Reviews.Author: thommacks
Reviews.Content: i am a westgate owner so this review does not please me to write it.that is one of the worse weeks i have ever spent in the states.no friendly welcome,got our room wrong and did nothing to fix it,almost tied me to the chair to buy another week,no friendly staff.had people moved in next door that thought they were the only people in the building,phoned down im still waiting for something to be done about it.and to finish off check out is at 10 door bell rang at 9.30 to almost put us out.they call it 5 starr i have had better at a 20 dollar a night motel.PATHETIC.

Reviews.Title: “Hope it's going to get better”
Reviews.Author: simonrobbie
Reviews.Content: After driving from PA over the last two days we arrived. My wife went in to check in and got schtuped into paying $20 and signed up to a 90 minute presentation the next day to get our "amenity tickets" we should get automatically as we are timeshare owners here. We finally got into our room (which is awesome except no free internet and blurry TVs). We looked out the balcony to a large sand pit where the water park is supposed to be. WTF? We went into the main area this morning and after being given the runaround for a while, my wife raised her voice. They called security and eventually refunded our $20 and gave us the amenity card. We left and had a great time at the local petting zoo. Hope things get better real soon. The front desk told us the manager came in at 11:30am and would call us. It's 5:20pm now and no messages on my wife's phone or the room phone.

Reviews.Title: “A Few Cons, but overall very good”
Reviews.Author: muscledfuture
Reviews.Content: First we travelled with our daughter, son in law and two small grandchildren the week before Easter. We flew into FLL and rented a minivan and drove up to the resort arriving at 1:30 a.m. Arrival/Service- At that hour one would expect quick service and no delay, but we requested a room on the WDW side of the Town Center so we could see the evening fireworks. Our concierge wanted to please us, but the room was under inspection (at nearly 2 a.m). We waited for 45 minutes and then he wanted to put us in the original ground floor suite - not. He corrected and at about 2:20 we were in. The Room- the next morning we were very happy with our suite. Spacious, clean, great view of Wilson Lake and WDW fireworks. We were near the pool with a snack bar, across the street from the mini golf and swan boats, activity center and fishing. The train stopped out front too- but it was basically a train to nowhere- just ran around the resort with no narration to point out the landmarks etc. There were hundreds of golf cards moving staff and timeshare tours though. AC worked fine and suite had a washer and dryer. The pool towels were small and thin, no tea pot or cookie sheet found, and the dishes were all glass (not my preference)- mugs for coffee small (Irish coffee glasses). We had room 5451 and the last couple of days one of the elevators was broken. They were painting and blowing leaves, planting flowers etc, throughout our stay. Services- They had mid week towel service which was nice but not necessay as the wasker/dryer was there. Service was slow at the pool bar and you had to carry cash as they would not let you charge it to your room. The activities center closed down at 7 p.m., which is way too early as the best time to do some minigolf is after dinner. They should remain open until at least 11. Movies in the theater- same thing. A later showing (9ish) would have been nice. The daily shuttles to Disney were at 9:15 and 12:30, with scheduled returns at 5:30 and 7:30. They filled up fast and we were not able to use them at all. The 30 weekly fee to use the facilities is easy to recoup if you golf a couple of times. Overall, I would rate the service as just average. We had a slow toilet drain one day and though the guy came and fixed it fairly quickly, he wanted someone to wait while he sent housekeeping to "clean" . Forty five minutes later no housekeeping and we went about our day as we felt we had wasted enough time. The resort is big- it was very crowded at the pool nearest us. It was really hot too, so the playgrounds were unusable due to the sun. The had a huge water slide-inflatable, but it cost 2 dollars a trip or 10 dollars an hour- direct sun. We opted out. We did not eat at any of the restaurants, but we did get snacks one day at the pool bar. Not impressed by service or prices there. Pools- there were a lot of them. The pool bars serve dark blue napkins, which invariable ended upo in the pool by mid afternoon. Not much shade available and very crowded. The hot tubs were pretty gross with mulch dragged in by folks who couldn't walk around or keep their kids from walking through. The kids'/wading pool with a watering umbrella was cold. Our waterbugs couldn't stay in there long. Pools open late- no lifeguards, few rules. Adults must keep a close eye on their kiddos- many did not. Location- one mile from Disney-as the crow flies- but in reality it is about 7-8. Parking 14 dollars a day at any park. There is not a good grocery story with bakery and deli nearby and the liquor store is pricey. Go once early in your stay to International Drive and get food and snack and alcohol. Plan ahead and you will be fine. There is an Edy's ice cream and discount gift shoppe about 3/4th of a mile from the resort. If you want luxury- skip this place, but if you want roomy, mostly clean comfort for a family, this will fit the bill. There is a good 3G network, so if you don't need a laptop and have an I phone save the ridiculous internet fees. Oddly enough, we were NEVER contacted one time about doing the timeshare tour! YAY!

Reviews.Title: “High Pressure Timeshare Pitch”
Reviews.Author: sswsc07
Reviews.Content: As a Westgate owner, I was not prepared to have to sit through yet another timeshare salespitch. It was high pressure and unpleasant. The lobby/reception area was unbearable with hundreds of people waiting in massive lines. It was worse than the lines at the attractions. Once settled into our room, which was very nice, we immediately realized that you could hear each and every noise coming from the adjacent rooms, including screaming babies and snoring adults. When the phone would ring next door, we literally thought it was our phone. Smoking was allowed on the patios, which made our patio unusable as the smoke would waft right in. There is no maid service unless you pay for it. There is no recycling program which I found amazing for a resort of that massive size. The pools were extremely crowded and the poolside bars and snack bars were overpriced. The one fitness center was way too small for the huge number of guests. And you had to pay $25/week for internet if you were an ownere. If you were a non-owner it was $40/week.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best places for families”
Reviews.Author: coruna1
Reviews.Content: As owners is the first time using the Resort, this review is for building 4000 in the town center. we were given an A & B room which is a 2 bedroom unit with 1 small kichenette and a full size kichen, 2 bathrooms & 2 living rooms, beautiful decoraded and kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need, washer and dryer, screened balcony with a table for four and a launche chair, located on the 8th floor. The only negatives are that walls are thin and people dont have respect for other people(banging doors at odd hours and sometimes talking loud) This building doesnt have a pool but is a short walk to other pools that are share by the people staying at the villas and the palace. The pools are okay, mostly very crowded and lots of people playing rough in the water as there are no life guards, if you have small children this can be a problem. The resort has a grocery store,deli, pizza restaurant and steak restaurant, we only use the pizza delivery which is was great and delicious, employees were nice, the sales men that try to book us for a meeting was deceiving and it was a little difficult to get him off the phone and to top it off he called us again a 8am that was anoying. As an owner we are very please and plan to come back as we have 4 weeks per year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: hotzhouse
Reviews.Content: We reserved a studio and were pleasantly surprised. The room was big - bedroom connected to living, dining, kitchen area. The bathroom had a jacuzzi which we enjoyed and was very large. The resort was quiet and the rooms were great. The pool was close by and had a bar connected with it for food and drinks. We'll stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ScatmanGL
Reviews.Content: Took a weekend trip from Miami and this is the best place to stay if you plan to go to Disney Parks. Excellent accomodations. Excellenet management team who strive to provide great service. Will come again when the weather gets cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: DLST
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at Westgate. The 1st time we stayed in the Vacation Villas in 2008. This time we stayed at the Town Centre, which is all part of the same complex, the Villas are two buildings, while the Town Centre is 6 to 8 storey buildings. For the most part our stay was fine. We arrived later in the evening on a Monday and check in was a breeze. No timeshare pressure, nothing, although they send you to three different people prior to someone taking you to your room, but still took less than 20 minutes. We had booked a 2 bedroom suite from Expedia.com. The suite was nicely maintained, pretty clean. Two double beds in 2nd bedroom, I think a queen in master room, and pull out couch. Well stocked kitchen. Bathrooms had plenty of towels and toilet paper. The only down fall was that this suite faced a very busy, very loud pool. The first night, since we arrived later and were very tired, we did not call security, but the 2nd night it was even louder, there were lots of young adults in the pool and hot tub. Around 2:00 a.m. I called security. Security claimed that the pool gates were “locked” every night and that the people must have “jumped” the fence. Somehow I don‘t think that the pools are locked, because you can hear the gates slamming shut when someone opens them. But security said they would send somebody and they must have because it did quiet down. The next day (Wednesday) I asked to be moved to a quieter building. They moved us no problem. Second unit was great too. The only issues with that suite was that some maintenance guy rang our doorbell at 12:45 a.m. Saturday night to ask if we had used the hot tub in the past week, and then mumbled something about a leak in the unit below us and left??? Not sure exactly what that was about. We had our infant daughter with us, so I was NOT impressed with that! The 2nd issue was also on the Saturday. New people moved in above us, and it was like a heard of elephants. They were awake until 4:00 a.m, screaming yelling, jumping, running, etc. The walls and floors are very hollow. Sunday night same thing, finally called security about 3:00 am. After that night, they were okay, you heard a bit, but it was manageable. Every morning, housekeeping came by to take the garbage and see if we needed new towels. Everyone we encountered was friendly. We did get a timeshare request late in the day, the day before we were suppose to leave. A man called saying I had to sign a sheet saying everything in the unit was in working order, so I met him at the main club house, and after a few minutes realized it was a timeshare pitch, I just politely declined, stating that we did not travel often enough to invest in a timeshare. Besides, now that we had a baby, we needed to put money into her education savings. He was fine with that and I went on my way. If we ever go back, I will know to decline that phone call. We used several of the pools on the complex. Being March, they were all pretty busy. All of them, except for one were warm. Warm enough so that it was comfortable for our 11 month old. We walked around the complex quite a bit and it was nice. The only thing what would have been nice, would be for Westgate to add a children’s splash and play area, the kind where little kids can sit and stand and play in water not too deep, but I think that they might be adding that when they start construction on the water park. Check out was quick and fine. Although the young girl at the counter had as much personality as a wet dish cloth. To my way of thinking, if you are in the hospitality industry, then you should have people who are friendly and outgoing, especially at the check in/check out desk, which by the way is different from the Guest Relations desk. The Guest Relations people I spoke with were friendly and very helpful. The only other complaint I have, like a lot of other people is that they charge $40.00 for internet for 7 days. Which is expensive. If we were to go back, next time I would request a room in the Villas, which are presently being renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to commit half of your precious vacation day to the timeshare speil!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Real_Talk1174
Reviews.Content: Not too bad for the price, but they need to truly raise the standards for cleanliness and the 5 HOUR (yes!!!! 5 whole hours) timeshare presentation was "simply put" a passive aggressive kidnapping or hostage negotiation. We arrived during spring break. The only time off that we have during the year. We were excited to stay with Westgate because we had vacationed there with my father the year before at the Westgate Lakes and loved it! So, we booked a 4 day/ 3 night, 4-br/ 4-ba condo to accommodate the 12 ppl in our party. The price and amenities were awesome ($190/ day for 4-br/ 4-ba) & couldn't be beat! The staff were extremely courteous (as I changed rooms twice because of noise and lack of view). However, when we did settle into our rooms, you could tell that the room inspection meant (check for beds made, fresh towels, and clean tubs-only) because no one had wipe down any of surfaces or even attempted to mop the floor or clean the mirrors or wipe down the grime on the doors. Notice, I keep saying "wipe down" because that's all that it took, had someone "inspected" the room like a guest and not an employee with sub-standards for clean. We spent the next hour doing what housekeeping should have done. Other than that, no other issues with the resort. Let me add, the kitchen was immaculate! The location was wonderful, just a short drive to Disney and there were other stores and restaurants nearby that made for ease of travel. So, why isn't my rating a bit higher?!?!? Two-words, Timeshare Presentation!!!!! Now, don't get me wrong, we already knew before coming to FL that we were probably gonna purchase, if the price was right. We even told the "used car salesman" type, "Joe" that he wasn't gonna have to work to hard, just show us a 2 br villa like my Dad's and let us know how much? So, Joe ignored our request and went in for the "hard sale". Again we told "Joe" that all of the "pitching" was unnecessary and to give us the bottom line, how much?!?! But being the passive aggressive, tunnel- visioned, "used car salesman" he was, he just kept going. Finally after having heard all about the owner, who he knows, "Joe's" personal testimony, every inch of the resort, being asked to wait for over 20 mins and given the whole "deed" speil, we finally figured that we had to match his aggressiveness with some of our own and demanded to know HOW MUCH?!?! (Not realizing that we have been there for four hours. We started at 7:30 am, it was now 11:30 am.) So finally, (after seeing that we were irritated and ready to say, we will do this some other time), "Joe" and his supervisor began with the "bait and switch" show about slashing payments and preferred weeks and upgrading to a 2 br w/ loft villa. Before we closed on our deal, we had been there 5 HOURS. So, instead of being excited about our purchase, we were tired, angry and irritated that half of our day was gone! Folks, our timeshare presentation started at 7:30 am, we were not released until 12:45 pm, and "Joe, the used car salesman" was so aggressive that even after the sale was OVER, we finally had to MAKE him leave us alone by complaining about how long it took and how we told him we wanted to buy, but he DRAGGED on forever. Once we got outside, it truly felt like we had been set free or released from some kind of jail or maybe even Hell. I wish that I could have made this shorter for you. But I wanted to give an accurate review. By the way, we decided that we needed to wait a year before purchasing, after all. So we opted to cancel our contract four days after being home. The timing for us just wasn't right and our contract had a 10-day cancellation option in it. Let's hope everything goes smoothly with it...I would hate to have to call the State AG's office, as I would one day in the near future truly wish to become an Owner at the Westgate Town Center without being held hostage by a desperate salesperson, that is.

Reviews.Title: “We were thrilled with our total experience at Westgate”
Reviews.Author: smadden11
Reviews.Content: Having read a number of the reviews here we didn't know what to expect, but everything exceeded our expectations. Check-in was quick and easy. Once we said "no thanks" to the time-share breakfast we never heard about it again. Our "efficiency" unit was more like a one BR suite - big living area, balcony, BR that could be closed off, 2 TVs. As an "efficiency" there was no stove, but full size refridge, microwave, coffee maker, flatware, plates, dish towels etc. Resort provided lots of activities on-site and was very convenient to all Orlando attractions. As someone else noted, there are signs that there are plans for new restaurants on-site. For the size of this resort (huge!) it seemed strange that currently there are no restaurants. That said, the deli was fully stocked and very convenient and there are loads of restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay just as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: brianbva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago and had a great stay. This time was just as good. We actually had two 2br units (friends stayed in the second one) just a few rooms apart from each other in the 5700 bldg facing the lake in the middle. We traded through Interval for one and used a bonus week for the other. I did the pre-check-in in at noon, rooms weren't ready, but that was expected. When I returned at 8pm to get the keys I was in and out in less than 3 minutes. Minimal timeshare pitch pressure, I just declined and was never asked again. Good: Very clean, granite countertops and table, fairly new furniture, comfortable beds, HUGE jacuzzi tub in master bath. Two issues that we had (safe and dvd player) were taken care of immediately, and staff followed up to make sure everything was fine. Bad: Nothing really bad, just differences between this and top-class places. Like: **a couple beer bottles and cans on the ground that hadn't been picked up yet; **DVD players are total junk (Really, they must cost about $5 each - no pause, ffwd or rewind - just play and stop; any scratches and it won't play at all). If you plan on watching lots of movies and you're driving, bring your own DVD player. You won't regret the decision. **Also, only about half the jets in the hot tub at the pool worked. **Tv's and stereo need a tech refresh. Still tube tvs in the bedrooms. The unit we stayed in last time had all flat screens, so I imagine they just haven't gotten to this bldg yet. Disclaimer: We didn't spend much time in the room overall and used very few of the services. We were at DW most of the time. Observation: There's a sign advertising a coming water park and new restaurants on property.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...would go again!”
Reviews.Author: 1951merc
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel from the moment we arrived. Very beautiful. Very nice staff. Already have a timeshare with them so wasnt bothered about that. Very helpful with finding good area restaurants. Helped to set up free shuttle to disney which you book in advance. (Shuttle was about 30 min late and very full though). Stayed in a 2 bedroom condo and one of the doors was broken but they immediately fixed it. Very clean and very nice room. Nice few of the fireworks at disney and lake. Very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place but very dated”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMac17
Reviews.Content: We received a bonus week for banking our Marriott timeshare week early and this was one of the places available. We usually stay only at other Marriott properties. The check in was a bit tiresome because we were taken to a desk to be given a card, then got in line and saw the front desk person, who then gave our keys to another person who signed us up for the breakfast and timeshare speil, (we did it for the free breakfast, disney gift card and discount park tickets, and free access to mini golf, swan boats, and sports equipment on site.), then we went with yet another person to show us where our room was. It took about 45 minutes and there was no line. Our room was very dated and there were a lot of mirrors in the bedroom. We were in the CCC building. It was sort of clean. There was what looked like coffee and leaves in the kitchen sink. There were lots of towels and pillows. The beds are a bit hard and the kitchen was a bit tight. There are a lot of pools at this resort and there was one right across from our room. However the pools by the towers have a kids splashing pool and are much more up to date so we drove over there and used that one after the first day. There is also a train they told us that would take you around but it runs very limited hours and after about 2:30 it really only does a loop from the front to the employee building for them to get off and on. Also the shuttle to the disney parks runs only two times in the morning. It is very close to the parks and several places to eat. There is also a super Target close by that is great for stocking your room up. The time share pitch was ok. We had a guy named Joey who did all the normal things like tell us about his personal life to make him seem like our friend. But he talked fast and his spiel was over quickly. Also when the guy was brought over to give us the price and my husband said no he tried a bit to get him to change his mind but did not get too pushy. He was obviously a bit annoyed but it was not too long. He also told us about the other building that they normally take people who are not staying at the resort he said you don't want to go there. (this was during the golf cart tour of property) so after we went to the gift room to get our stuff and they offered us a bonus gift of discount tickets to a dinner if we went to another presentation that was an hour long in that building. We declined. Overall it was an ok place to stay not fancy but we were at the parks most the time and it was free for us. I would stay there again if it was with a free week but otherwise I would go to another Marriott property.

Reviews.Title: “Not so stellar start... a bit scary...but improved in the end”
Reviews.Author: pslgrl
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Friday night about 9, check-in was busy, so it took about 30 minutes. After checking in we were escorted to the "other" desk where they attempt to get you to take in breakfast or brunch to sell you a timeshare. We are from Florida and know the whole gammit so declined....but then we were told we would be escorted to our room by another employee! I thought to myself, WOW, they are really trying to sell these units! (not a bad thing...that's how they grow) We arrrived to our building and the escort couldn't locate our room (on the first floor). The key and room number on his sheet didn't agree. He was persistent to get us settled and tried every room on the floor (he tried everything AND we were saved from the sales pitch to attend the timeshare presentation). Apparently the check in host didn't program the key. So, tired kids in tow, we loaded up and went back to the main building at Town Center. Since he had to re-program the cards, my husband suggested we get a higher floor because of noise, etc....they accommadated us and we proceeded once again (tired kids in tow) to find that they assigned us a room with only one bedroom, we booked a 2. We go back to Town Center and they told us we booked a 1 bdrm. They call a supervisor and instead of speaking to me (I'm right next to our ESCORT) she tells him our reservations state a 1 bdrm. I look her in the eye and explain that we are very tired, it's now 10:15 and we will pay the difference if we have to, whatever...get me to bed! She says that the room has to be cleaned and inspected and it would be an hour before we can access...ok we'll go to grab some stuff from the store..cranky kids in tow (6 & 8). Come back at 11...different escort...very nice and helpful settling us into our room, he helped unload our bags and refrigerated purchases. My daughter goes to her bed to lay down and shrieks ROACH! A big one daddy! The escort was still there and saw it in her bed! He sat down immediately and phoned the front desk...yes we live in Florida and palmetto bugs live here too...but not in our beds! So here we go again, this time gathering all of our unloaded stuff, everything! Quickly! (so we don't have any hitchhikers!) The escort spared us the pain of going back to Town Center Hall to move rooms...he opened our new room in the 6000 building, and after a thorough check we were ok with it..he left and returned with our new keys within 20 min. Stellar service (from the escorts) at this point. So I mentioned earlier they said we booked a 1 instead of 2 bdrm...we had to pay an additional $84...even though it was their mistake. Well, since we didn't offically get a room until 12:30 Saturday morning you bet I was calling another manager. After notfying her of our experience she refunded us for the night...good move because word spreads quickly. Overall - It was a scary place to sleep for the first night, no roaches or issues the rest of the stay (3 nights). I would say if we didn't go through the first night the way we did, it would have been a diffrent experience. First impressions are lasting. One other key thing - we were not the only ones complaining. There were several people that we heard complaining of ants in their bed, etc...this is Florida and there are bugs - but ROACHES in the bed..NOOOOO. The premises were kept well (should focus that effort on interiors as well). The staff, except for the first supervisor encounter, were customer service oriented. We survived. I would not recommend this place to anyone I know though.

Reviews.Title: “Want the REAL deal? Read my review!”
Reviews.Author: Keinika
Reviews.Content: So, honestly, the Westgate Town Center is the BEST place for families with kids to vacation in the Orlando-Kissimmee area. Especially if you don't want to got bankrupt at Disney! I will be honest...I am an owner of this timeshare, sort of, however, I'm not biased to them because I am also a travel planner so I look at everyone. Im only 28 years old and I have vacationed in the Orlando-Kissimeee area about 8 to 9 times in my lifetime so I know what I'm talking about! I'm gonna break this down in parts: RESORT - IT IS A TIMESHARE!!!! So, YES, they are going to try to get you to go on a timeshare tour! Depending on your vacations needs it might be worth it. We went on a timshare tour and we saved about $50 (maybe more) or our Disney tickets! For me, that was a good deal. I took that $50 I saved to the outlet mall and got some killer shoes and beautiful earrings! Anyway, if you don't want to take the tour then just say no. BE CAREFUL WHEN BOOKING! Certain rates you book require that you go on the timeshare tour, some don't. (Contact me and I can help you with that!) Anyway, the resort is AMAZING! Everyday there was a boat load of stuff to do! Free Disney movies, fishing, paddle boats, golf, BBQ's by the pools and a daily list of activites. They keep you busy so you don't have to spend all your cash at the parks. The resort is large but there's transporation to take you around if you don't want to drive your car. Or you could walk! We walked and the scenery was awesome! There was Pizza Hut and grocery store with deli near our villa but I heard there was another restuarant on the property. They are in the process of building a waterpark there too. It was ready yet so they've rented a HUGE water slide until its ready. ROOM - I didn't want to leave! We had a 1 bedroom villa with a patio. My husband and I's bedroom had a jacuzzi tub that was sooooo relaxing! The bed had dozens of pillows, mirrors over the headboard with some soft lighting. The bathroom had 2 shower heads, regular and rain shower. Double sinks were a blessing! We had a flat screen TV in our room and our room had its own entrance to the patio. The living room had a leather sofa sleeper and love seat. We put those two together to make beds for our then 6 year old and 3 month old daughters. They also had their own flat screen tv, DVD player, and music sound system. There was also a full dining table for 6 and a breakfast nook type table on the other side on the kitchen counter. The KITCHEN! Oh, how I LOVED that kitchen! Electric stove with oven, dishwasher, garbage disposal, microwave, appliances, refrigerator with icemaker, washer AND dryer, and all the cookware and dishes you need! They even provided detergent for the laundry and dishes! There was also a safe, broom, mop, laundry basket, iron with ironing board and all the regular and pool towels you could ever need! LOCATION - Disney was literally around the corner, I'm serious! It took us 5, maybe 10 minutes to reach the parking lot gates. We were 2 minutes for the main strip with all the restaurants, shopping, and WALMARTS!!!! And everything was a quick hop on the expressway. Airport was about 15 to 20 minutes away. SERVICE - They gave us such great service that I mailed them some customer reviews when I got back home. We had some issues with our room and everytime they came right away and fixed what needed to be fixed! One issue was with our toliet and they were having some trouble fixing it so they were going to move us (themselves) to a better room! They eneded up fixing it and it stayed fixed the entire time! Everyone we encountered helped us so much. Hmmm, I don't know what else to say! If you have any more questions, let me know, message me and I can answer them!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: DebbieMaderaCA
Reviews.Content: We exchanged a 1 bdrm timeshare for a week at Westgate in a 1 bdrm, 2 bath villa. We rented a car and drove straight from the airport. We arrived around 6pm. Check-in was fast and easy. An employee provided us with an envelope full of stuff and told us about the free breakfast and bar-b-que and free activities. I suspected this was a timeshare presentation and immediately told him, "Not attending either." He said activities would not be free, but nobody asked us again. An employee accompanied us to our room. That was nice. At first sight, we were disappointed in our villa. We have owned for only 3 years and have exchanged 3 times. This exchange has been the least elegant we have encountered. I didn't realize that the villas were the oldest accommodations. And, ours did not have a patio or a balcony! The decorating was cheezy and dated. The TV's were tube-type. Our previous exchanges all had new, slim LCD TV's. Furthermore, the internet cost $40/ week. We have always found internet to be free. My husband had his "card" with him so we could use the laptop in our room. Westgate provided a "computer center" in which you could load a card and use it to access the internet ($.20/minute, $.75/printed sheet). Using that card I accessed my e-ticket to print my boarding pass for the next day. I ended up spending $12 to accomplish this. Frustrating and ridiculous!!! That said, the villa was clean and quiet and spacious. We were in building SSS and the pool/jacuzzi area was hardly used the week we were there. The pool water was a perfect temperature the jacuzzi clean and hot and bubbling. The grounds were beautiful. We bought a couple of things from the market. We bought most of our groceries from a nearby Super Walmart. The benefit of buying at the market is smaller sizes. We didn't consume all the meat we purchased or use up the condiments. Probably would have paid the same money for smaller versions--but, I hate to waste food. We were not provided with a TV Channel Guide. I called and was told I would have to go over to the Welcome Center and pick one up. Why wasn't that in the envelope full of stuff? There were a couple of channels that were not listed on the guide. Another aggravation was a couple of pools advertised "happy hour" 5-7. We went over on Saturday night to one pool and the bar was closed. We were directed to another pool. That one was close to our room and was open. We returned to that pool on Tuesday (where a sign advertised food and happy hour) and the bar was closed. It was sprinkling and we didn't feel like walking to the other, more distant pool to check it out. Some consistency would have been nice! My experience with villas and timeshares is there is no daily cleaning and we put out our own trash. That was true at Westgate. Clean towels were provided half-way through our stay. That was nice. The queen-sized bed was comfortable, but a hallway light just outside the bedroom window interfered with our getting a good night's sleep all week. Black-out drapes over the horizontal blinds would have helped. Loved the security gate on the property. The resort is also very centrally located to many attractions. If we return to the Orlando area, I will probably research other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but know what you are getting into!”
Reviews.Author: bearpawqs
Reviews.Content: We have been owners here for 5 years. While the resort is very nice you need to know what you are getting into when you stay here. Our visit this October was less than stellar and we have made our experience know to management so hopefully they will do something about the customer service and attitudes of some of the staff. My first piece of advice is unless you know you want to buy a timeshare, don't go to the sales pitch. It is very high pressure and when you say no the pressure intensifies. Each time you say no they bring out someone higher up the food chain. After saying no to three different people their attitudes shift and they become rude and unprofessional. If you are really serious about buying a timeshare, shop around first. We actually prefer to stay in the Villas. Yes they are older but they are quieter and more our speed. The high rises in Town Center are cheaply made for what you pay for. You can hear your neighbor’s conversations and you can hear the people above you walking, running, jumping, or moving furniture. There can't be any type of insulation or sound barriers. We requested a unit on the top floor but in so doing we had to wait four hours to be checked in. The front desk was not helpful and the customer service skills that day were pathetic! The staff at the Deli/Store was fabulous. They greeted us with smiles and welcomes and the Deli staff remembered our preferences and our names! They were great. The grounds are nice enough. Very neat and clean. If you have children just be aware that the grounds are really not set up for pedestrian traffic. What look like sidewalks are not sidewalks but golf cart highways. They will run you over if you aren't watching. Just another reason why we prefer the Villas. (Shh, don't tell anyone) The maintenance crew was also excellent and johnny on the spot with things that needed fixing. What we really like about the timeshare is having a full kitchen to make our own meals, we can do laundry as we need to and actually do it before we leave instead of having to do it all when we get home. Plenty of room to relax and close enough to Disney to enjoy what they have to offer. So why would I not recommend this place to those I care about? The high pressure sales, staff copping attitudes, poor customer service, and Westgate has not proven to us that we made a wise choice! Oh yeah, their internet service is basically non existent. It has been for 5 years. Excuse after excuse.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MarkandBonnie
Reviews.Content: We read a lot of negative comments about this place. We had already traded for this time-share and were stuck with it for two weeks. All our fears were for nothing…. The property was wonderful. The staff was terrific and right on time every time we need something. This is a Time-Share property so the room gets a touch up mid-week and a thorough cleaning once a week. We got a three bedroom suite. The rooms were big, clean and comfortable, the grounds were beautifully kept, pools were awesome. The only draw-back was that check-in was chaotic - sending you to this person then that person all a ploy to schedule you for a timeshare spin, which we kept turning down. We finally were taken to our room by someone who said he was our (rep) (short for Salesman). On a guise that he was checking the maintenance of the room he scheduled some time with us, after explaining (several times that we had enough time-shares) we finally had to walk out on him and his supervisor. But again the Property was great and if we go to see Micky Mouse again we will try to stay here. Did I mention we could see the Fireworks from our room. Really close to WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Lingering disappointment”
Reviews.Author: carijudy
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at a guest of an owner and while the majority of the stay went off without issue, the customer service we experienced was borderline terrible. First off, we arrived with a later check-in and were told our rooms were not ready. It turns out they were, but needed to be unlocked, while this key was went and got or this person needed to go and unlock the doors to the attached rooms. It was just too much chaos for the us and several of the children we had with us. Then, as I went to get into bed that night and pulled the covers back the sheets were covered in all kinds of I don't know what. It looked like little spots of blood clustered near the top and lots of little dark brown specs of dirt. At 10pm, after a long day, quite exhausted, my mind immediately went to bed bugs. I was upset and furious and called to get new sheets. While waiting, my sister and I scoured the bed and frame to see if they were bed bugs, and were relieved that we didn't find any. After waiting over 30 minutes for the sheets, the doorbell rang and we were handed a plastic bag. It was ridiculous that we then had to try an make the bed with the wrong size sheets! We were too exhausted to call down for another set, and I just slept on top of them. The next day we got clean sheets, but again had to put them on the bed ourselves. After this annoying first night, I resolved to just relax and let it go. Am glad I did as the rest of the trip stay there were no more problems. That is until we left. We had several children with us and as you can imagine, it was a bit loud getting everyone's things together and out the door. Well, a watch got left behind. It was noticed almost immediately that it was left so we called and were told to leave a voicemail with the lost and found department. I very explicitly described the watch, where it was left and that it could have possibly fallen behind the headboard or the desk. No once called us back after a couple of days so I called again and was told to leave another voicemail which I did. While we were there, the building we were in was fairly empty, so I assumed it may have taken a couple of days to clean the room. So I was giving them the benefit of the doubt. But again, so response, so I called again. Nothing. The fourth time I called, I tried to let the receptionist/phone operator know that I was tired of leaving voicemails as no one was calling me back, but was told that that was the only department I could deal with for a lost item. It's quite upsetting that I still haven't heard anything...not even a courtesy call to say they looked for the watch and couldn't find it. Was it possible I left it someplace else or something like that. But no contact from the at all. There was a lot of sentimental value for this watch and it’s a bit disturbing that I couldn’t even get a call back. Even at the least starred places, I never been ignored when I’ve had an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better!”
Reviews.Author: sunlover649
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3rd trip to Orlando staying at the Westgate. Each time our stay gets better. We had a top floor with an amazing view of fireworks from Magic Kingdom and Epcot. The resort is beautiful and so comfortable. It is so nice to have room to stretch out and have some privacy. We also shopped at Target for snack foods and breakfast foods which was convenient and saved a few dollars. It was also great to have a washer and dryer. This resort is right next to World Drive and so easy to get to all the parks including SeaWorld and Universal which are 20 mins. away. This time we had one day to relax and enjoy the resort property. The pool with the bar and arcade was so great with the beautiful lake view behind it. The room was immaculate, the grounds are beautiful and everyone we encountered couldn't be more helpful. I would highly recommend Westgate Town Center to anyone. I just wish we could afford to purchase because it just doesn't get any better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Studio Room - only if you don't settle for less”
Reviews.Author: kitchenchemist
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked at the Westgate Vacation Villas studio room and when I checked online, as previously stated by another guest, it was a two bedroom hotel room. I called and spoke to a supervisor and asked to be changed a Town Center studio, which is a one bedroom, living area/kitchenette room. I was in 5356B, a newer building. Nice vestibule entering into apartments A & B. Clean room, couple minor maintenance issues, fixed quickly, lots of fresh towels,lot of pillows, nice bed linens, sofa bed ok. Big bathroom- with separate shower enclosure, big soaps. Shampoo, conditioner, full coffee pot, with one pot service. Pool, mini-golf nearby.
