Sales people everywhere desperately wanting to seal a deal- it is a timeshare complex. They do hold onto your keys and give you the pitch before you get to your room. Huge complex. Plenty of things for families to do. No free wifi. I paid $59+ (but remember I was upgraded upon request.) Got an early (11 AM) check-in upon request also. A $50 deposit required at check-in - refunded, if not used at check out. See my photos.

Reviews.Title: “Westgate Town Center has everything we desire for a great vacation in Florida.”
Reviews.Author: Alfie45
Reviews.Content: .We enjoy staying at Westgate because of its convenient location,roomy accomodations,ammenities,and friendly staff. We particularly love the huge columned hot tub in the master bedroom.There is something for every age here from theme parks to playgrounds,paddle boats, shopping and great dining. The pools and fitness center are well maintained. Families and couples of all ages would enjoy this resort.

Reviews.Title: “not as advertised...”
Reviews.Author: FlThrifty1
Reviews.Content: Just came fro staying at Westgate Town Center, we had booked a suppossed studio unit, which in all other places I have booked that type of room comes with a small table,chairs,a small living room with a pull out sofa, and a partioned or separate bedroom. Not so here, all you get under this type of room is a bedroom with two double beds, a small fridge, a microwave, and plates and utensils.No, you do not get a table to eat whatever you have cooked, or even a couch to sit in, no chairs either unless you count the one chair for the small desk next to the tv. Also, there is nobody at the pools to monitor the signs that they have telling people that there are no unsupervised children allowed, or no diving into the pools, or glass cups allowed. All in all very disappointed, having stayed at other timeshare units that provide better accomodations, and better supervision of common areas, allowing their guests time to relax, and enjoy their vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews almost scared us off!”
Reviews.Author: metfanatic11
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here, we were nervous upon arrival. Our minds were put at ease very quickly. I can't comment on the sales process because we are using it as a guest of a timeshare owner so we didn't receive any sales pitch at all. We stayed in the 5400 building in the town center and we couldn't be happier with the room. Cleanliness could be a little better but nothing major. The grounds are very well kept and the service staff that we've been in contact with have been very nice. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: ENj
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about staying here due to other reviews I have read on this hotel. Once we arrived I was sure it was going to be terrible as check in took an hour on line and then off to staff trying to schedule a timeshare tour. I declined and they didn't have a problem with it. One of the staff members escorts you to your room and shows you around, nice personal touch. The property is HUGE and is maintained well and very clean. Our room was HUGE. We traded in our two bedroom timeshare for this property. It was two floors a master bedroom with a master bath, kitchen, living room with sleeper sofa, 2nd bedroom with 2 beds and a bathroom, nice kitchen, dining room, laundry room, and 2nd floor had 2 twin beds also unit had a private balcony. Safe area and parking lot and there is security at gate making sure everyone who is getting in belongs there. Drive is not to far maybe 10 minutes from the Disney parks and area attractions. They have pools throughout the property, also childrens park area and mini golf. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs! Totally flawless!”
Reviews.Author: Mike_and_Nicky
Reviews.Content: We are a young Scottish couple, and have just spent the most amazing two weeks in Orlando. The hotel being one of our biggest fears (due to negative reviews) turned out to be one of the highlights! It was amazingly clean, the maid attended with fresh towels every morning, there were enough facilities for us to have breakfast before venturing out, the hotel was not only close to the parks, but also to the 192 where you can find lots of other attractions and restaurants. It was great to come back at night, open a beer and watch a movie (the tv had a good choice of channels including hbo movie channels). Just another small thing, but it made me smile everytime. When you drive up to the security office on the way in, expect a smile and a salute from the extremely pleasant and efficient security staff once they get to recognise your car. Honestly, if you are a young couple out to have a blast in Florida, this place will fit your needs perfectly. No complaints whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Stay was OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: nedburfle
Reviews.Content: Got room on Hotwire for $49/night. Was worried about all the negative reviews, but loved the price! Room on Hotwire was listed as a "suite". It would have been very small for 4 of us - two parents and two teenagers. Fortunately we got upgraded to the next bigger size suite because they screwed up our reservation. Observations: 1. Cleanliness - no problems. Room had a little bit of a musty smell, though. The grounds are well kept and pretty. 2. AC - didn't work very well. Room would get up to 79 by end of day (mid-August).. Two ceiling fans helped and we weren't ever in the room until after 7:00 p.m. 3. Registration - staff was friendly and helpful. It was a slow week they said. Pressure to "meet for breakfast and tour the facilities" so they could try to sell us a time share was not too bad. We brushed them off easily. 4. Parking was good, close to room. Pool was good, but loud at night. We stayed on 5th floor and it was still loud until it closed at 11:00. Fortunately, we travel with ear plugs! 5. Bedding - king bed in room was ok, but sofa couch was lumpy. We put the mattress on the floor and slept there. 6. Bathroom - great! Had good water pressure in shower and the bathroom was big 7. Security - you have to go through a gate to get in and there was always someone on staff driving around the area. We felt secure. Overall, ******for the price*******, it was a good deal. We spent most of our time out of the room and just needed a place to sleep and shower and this was sufficient for that.

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Wolves in Sheep's Clothing”
Reviews.Author: nascar141984
Reviews.Content: Okay, it was mine and my wife's first vacation experience at a Westgate resort and it will most definitely be our last! If we knew what kind of lies and junk we were going to have to put up with this week, we would never have chosen this place. The facilities were adequate, however, management and staff were often inconsiderate and rude especially when we declined their offer to purchase a timeshare. If considering Westgate PLEASE be aware that they are EXTREMELY pushy and do not hesitate to use pressure and other unethical means when presenting their timeshare information. Despite our repeated adamant refusals they continued to push their sales presentation on us. When we again refused to purchase they became downright rude and one representative made several sarcastic remarks to us. We were naturally very shocked and disgusted and could not wait to leave. We also were not told that all our payments on the vacation were put into an escrow account towards the PURCHASE of one of their villas!!! We were then forced to sit through another sales presentation before we could sign off and leave!! I could continue but I will finish with this-- before leaving to go on our Westgate vacation, we read many other reviews (mostly negative I might add) and figured the negative reviews were just posted by whiny and negative people and couldn't REALLY be all that bad. It is a cruel irony that I find myself posting yet another negative BUT TRUE representation of this place!! STAY AWAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOULD NEVER COME BACK!”
Reviews.Author: Iverson1407
Reviews.Content: Ok quite frankly, the rooms were below average to average being that they were pretty outdated with old TVs, horrible beds, and dirty showers. The lobby was pure CHAOS with all the WG employees trying to pressure any and everybody into a highly overrated timeshare! It was like they were 'herding sheep', it's ridiculous. The customer service absolutely sucked as well because the employees are LIARS, to say the least. LASTLY, I would advise anyone who visits Orlando to just pick another place to stay. Period.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: donttrustWG
Reviews.Content: I purchases a week vacation at the Westgate Town Center for $1295. I called several times to make sure my reservation was for the Town Center and not the Villas. The Villas is the old section. Anyway, I even talked to a WG rep on the way to the resort to make sure my room would be in Town Center. When I arrived, I was told that the Town Center was full and I was placed in the Villas. Instead of staying in a 2 bd room at the TC, I stayed in a 2 bd room loft in the Villas. Of course I was very disappointed because I verified my reservation in TC more than once. And I was not trying to get something for nothing...I paid $1295 for the week. The difference between TC and Villas is like night and day. The TC was built somewhere between 2006 - 2010 (depending on the building), wheras the Villas was built around the 1970's. I was told by WG reps that the company who sold me the VOA week for $1295 was found to have engaged in deceptive practices and was discharged by WG earlier this year. I also forgot to mention that I purchased this VOA week during a timeshare tour at the WG TC last year(2009). Seeing that I made my reservation in Oct 2009, and verified the reservations several times this year, I didn't think I should suffer for the deceptive practices by company that was representing WG on their property. Because of this bait and switch, I would not trust WG again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great view, relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: scmami
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from July 13-18,2010. I have stayed at several Westgate properties over the years. We traded through Interval International about two and a half weeks before our stay. The only rooms available in Orlando for our trade were all "studio/hotel" sized. Which meant NO full kitchen, washer/dryer, or separate living area. We were traveling with a 10,7, and 3 year old so we were concerned. However, when we checked in, we had a pleasant surprise! Our room was a one bedroom with a queen sized bed, a separate living room with a sleeper sofa, full sized fridge, and microwave, and a balcony! Much better than we expected. We also lucked out and got a first floor end unit which was great for the kids. We were in unit 5617B. The bathroom was granite and had a jetted tub that we never did get to use because it takes like an hour to fill up. Anyway there were paddle boats, bikes to rent, Disney movies in a mini theater (seats maybe 100 ppl), and activities every day. We loved the location as we usually stay off 192 anyway. Best Westgate yet. Oh, btw try to stay in the TOWN CENTER not the Villas because I think those seem to be older according to the reviews. Also friends of ours stayed at Westgate Lakes......(loved them as a kid/teen...as an adult...no way...they really need to update). We had a view of the lake and the giant water slide which the kids loved. Would book this one again!!. Pros: See above PLUS only asked about timeshare breakfast once Cons: Guard at entrance was rude, sugar ants got into the kitchen, no broom in suite although most floors were tile.( But I asked, and they brought one immediately).

Reviews.Title: “I'm not a review writer normally, but please take time to hear me...”
Reviews.Author: CLBeckTAMU
Reviews.Content: Normally I'm not one to throw my 2 cents in. But, I have to in this situation. For those of you (like me) that don't think reading any of these negative reviews would ever happen to me, please take all the negative reviews about this property into consideration. I'm so frustrated with this stay I'm still here on vacation writing this review. For those of you like me that work hard all year for a nice vacation with your family, you really can't afford for it to be a bad one, because you won't get another one until next year. This property has a very long check in experience. We were already tired from travelling, we really didn't want to wait in line for 1 hour then go thru a "special" tour as a cover-up time share marketing piece. Fortunately, we've learned the timeshare sales pitches by now and already own one and are happy with just one. The pictures of this property do look great, but it's like looking at a Big Mac picture, you really don't get what you see. Rooms are very small and cramped. Even took my empty suitcases out to the SUV to conserve space in the room. The room was very hot upon check-in. The AC really wasn't sufficient enough to catch up and cool it off until the next day. Leave it on the whole time if you want a cool room in mid-summer. The bathtub wouldn't drain and I had to get a maintenance man at 11pm out to unclog the tub. That can happen anywhere, but it just seemed like the straw that broke the camel's back to me. There were only 3 rags in the room for us (family of 4 staying for a week), so I requested about 8pm that those be brought to us by housekeeping. It's a mystery where they are located at so you have to request things be brought, you really can't just go to them. At 11pm when I requested the tub be unclogged, I also cancelled my request for the extra rags to be brought since we decided to just deal with it the next day. Maintenance guy was very nice and unclogged the tub about 11:15pm. At 1230am I'm awakened by a knock - housekeeping bringing me my extra rags. What a night, very frustrating. Then the real trouble starts the next day. At this point we've decided we are going to spend as much time away from the resort as possible because it's not really a resort, it's just a bad situation we want to stay away from and only sleep there because it's the roof over our head for the week. A new party is checking in next door. A girls basketball team playing in a regionals tournament i believe. They are mid-teens. This property has a common exterior door leading into a common area with an A-unit and a B-unit. It's really too close for comfort. I know that I'm in Orlando and it's not the mountains where you can have peace and quiet. But, being the team player that I am, I'm not the type to complain until it gets ridiculous. After 12 am I politiley knocked on their door, and the adults in the room were very rude and irresponsible. I could smell alcohol, which really concerned me for those teenage girls, I even saw 2 men come and leave at one point very late at night.. I immediately lost the being on vacation feeling and back to the real world feeling. I complained to security and front desk of the noise, door being left open and music playing loudly. Front desk is no help at all, security is very nice and tries to do their job, but really, what can they do?? It finally went quiet about 3 am every night. We are leaving 2 days early to have a nice weekend back at home before work starts back. There is nothing special about this place, please stay away for your family's sake. If I've discouraged one family from coming here, I've done my job. The management at this property really only has two concerns - keeping it booked up and timeshares being sold. Best wishes in your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money! STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: TurnerRN
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be a resort, but it offers very few anemities. Internet usuage costs .20cent/minute. The deli closes very early. The pizza hut on the property charges double what the pizza hut up the street from the property charges and they will deliver to your villa. Most activities like bike riding and the paddles boats are not available until 12noon, right in the heat of the day. The staff is very rude, especially the timesshare salespeople. One went so far as to tell us if we were not going to buy, then we needed to get the hell off the property. When we asked him not to speak to us that way he basically said why don't you hit me if you don't like it. It took us 2 days and at least 3 calls to corporate office to be able to speak to a manager. Everyone kept giving us the run around. We told them no one should be spoken to that way. The corporate office kept telling us to talk to the hotel manager and the so-called managers kept telling us to talk to corporate. It was horrible. The place is very unorganized and we will never stay there again. They are a bunch of liars. We were told that we did not even have to hear a sales pitch, yet they tried to push one on us anyway. You will do much better staying at the Sheraton Vistana Villages, Marriot Residence Inn, or a Disney Resort. We have never had a problem with any of these places and they have much better anemities.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it here!”
Reviews.Author: mallgirlfrg
Reviews.Content: Here a lot of negative things about this place,but I don't have a negative thing to say about it.When I checked in I had no wait,and everyone was very nice.I did get asked about the time share deal,but when I said I was not interested i was not pushed into it.i had an awesome room on Swan Lake.I asked for a studio,but I believe I may have gotten a one bedroom.It had a private balcony and was very spacious.i was there by myself,so I had plenty of room,but 4 people would have been comfortable.I did not drive ,so they took me to my room in a golf cart.I also needed to go to the market on site,and just called transportation and they drove me there and waited for me and drove me back.I hear people complain about their room,I was in room 5722 in building 5700 and was very happy with it.I look forward to staying there again,although it is not as close to Disney as they say.Yes Main gate is a mile away ,but anyone who has been to the Magic Kingdom knows it is another 4 or 5 miles to the parking lot.Maingate does not have a shuttle,so you either have to rent a car or take a cab.That was the only downfall.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in West Gate was a delight.”
Reviews.Author: skodiyal
Reviews.Content: Had a spacious room with a king bed and plenty of space. The kitchen was awesome with all the amenities. The best part was the swimming pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “***Great Place to Stay***”
Reviews.Author: deems774
Reviews.Content: We loved it. We wish we could have stayed in the room a little more. Had plans for Disney all week. Room was very spacious and very clean. Very very nice place. We checked in really late and it check in was very quick and easy. We did not have to do the presentation we booked ours through interval international. Check out was also a breeze. It took about 5 minutes. We would definately stay here again. If we come back this is where we will stay everytime. I just can't say enough about how nice it was. I did ask for one of the newer rooms. We had a washer and a dryer in the room which was very nice. We loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: busyathome21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days with our boys, 2 and 4 years old. We can't say anything about the value because a friend lent us their timeshare. We loved it. The rooms were big and large. There was a HUGE jacuzzin in the master bedroom. Kids thought it was a pool. We usually stay on property at Disney. Having the extra space was wonderful. The resort had so much to offer for familes. The pool near our building was a good size and never too busy. They have Disney movies shown in a theatre for the kids. They even have a tram that looks like Thomas the Tank engine that takes you from place to place around the resort. The customer service was on top of their game. We checked in mid week and it was quick. We had a bell hop escort us to our room and make sure the keys worked. He was very friendly and helpful. One of the sinks in the bathroom clogged up. They had it fixed within 30 minutes of our phone call to guest services. The location was also perfect. It took us about 10 minutes to get to any of the Disney theme parks. Loved this resort!

Reviews.Title: “ENJOYED!!!”
Reviews.Author: Increase2
Reviews.Content: Check-In: Unfortunately, it did take some time to check-in but it was not due to being harassed into buying or upgrading a timeshare. It was due to lack of knowledge of the person checking us in. Room: We were in 5200 building. It is not a nice as some of the new areas, but it is okay. It lacks the flat screen tvs, tub/shower combo in guest bathroom and granite counter tops. On a positive note, it is in walking distance to most of the onsite activities. Dining: There is no more breakfast in the main building (even though it is advertised on westgate channel in the room), but on some days, a continental breakfast is offered for owners. The onsite food places are average. Therefore, I recommend renting a car if it is in the budget. Also, please beware of local restaurants that offer the very cheap rates for breakfast. All I can say is that you get what you pay for. OnSite Activities: There are paddle boats, bicycles, putt putt golf and a train. Unfortunately, all of these close rather early (about 6pm), considering it is still daylight until almost 8pm. According to the brochure given at check-in, the train stops at 3pm. The main problem with the train is locating it. Yes, there are train stops located throughout the resort, but no times are listed. I witnessed guests just flagging it down and getting on. Figured I would try it as well (whenever I saw it) and it worked fine. It was refreshing to ride around the resort to get an overview of all that is offered. Also, drinks served at pool 1 and 13 were pretty good. The games and music during smash burger days were entertaining to say the least. Internet: Wireless is available but at a cost -approximately $50 for guests and $25 for owners. The cost would not have been nearly as bad if the internet was not running at toad speed. When viewing the available westgate connections, approximately three show up. Depending on location, only one can be used. The one dedicated to our building had two bars associated with it and was not reliable.

Reviews.Title: “OK but probably wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: Nofibgb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a two bedroom that overlooked the lake and the mini golf course. Overall, we were a little disappointed. Some of our disappointment had more to do with the people than the place itself. I'm not sure if they get a lot of visitors doing the 3 night promo stay or what but there seemed to be a lot of teenage or early twenties couples. This place is pretty loud and I'm really glad we were on the sixth floor as I don't know if our kids (5 and 1) could have slept with the noise if we were on one of the lower floors. I don't know if the pools are open all night but there were people at the pools really late. The rooms are pretty outdated. There are mirrors all over that reminds you of some place from the 80's. Didn't like the tile floor throughout the place. Carpeting is more comfortable and don't have to worry about a toddler falling on it. The dishwasher must have been twenty years old and we were too afraid the racks would fall when we put the dishes in to use it. There are a lot of pools but they aren't very big so some of them get pretty clogged up. We didn't like the area of Orlando it was in either. If you think of the cheesy gift shops and neon t-shirt places, this is it. Overall, the grounds are very nice but the place is just so big with so many people that we never got the "relaxed, on vacation feeling" that you have at other places.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: paohmi
Reviews.Content: Did not get the timeshare unit we were promised upon making reservation. Instead was put in the "TownCenter Unit 5000" facing Swan Lake. Big disappointment. This was a very small one bedroom studio with a lumpy king bed and a pull out sleeper sofa in the living/kitchen area that was the pits. If it would have been my sofa bed it would have been out with the garbage! Very lumpy and no padding. Impossible to get any sleep due to the swimming pool across the lake. Apparently the sliding glass doors in bedroom are not very good because noise came right through them. Pool did not shut down at 10:00pm like they said it did. Noise until 11:00pm or later. Plus three different nights parties where going on at all hours of the night. Third night I called security to quiet the party which they did. A/C is hooked up to shut down upon opening a door so even though we would set it down when we left the place in the morning thinking it would be very cool when we got back it wasn't. It hadn't even ran....place was always hot, stuffy and humid. It would take hours to get it comfortable. Don't expect clean towels or bedding everyday. Only gave us clean towels mid week not clean sheets. Plus there is limited places to hang wet towels, etc. The bathroom had a separate toilet room but it was so small our knees hit the door when you closed it. Then my son wanted the high speed internet they advertise. Big mistake. Doesn't work everywhere. Not enough routers in the buildings. My son had to go next door to the lobby of the place every evening to get connected. Very disappointed in our week's stay. Would not recommend wasting your money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!”
Reviews.Author: steve34609
Reviews.Content: We purchased annual passes to Disney this year so I did quite a lot of research on hotels,motels,resorts and suites in the Orlando area.This included price,location,floorplan,amenities and reviews.We wanted to have a "home base" for exploring all of the parks that would not cost us an arm and a leg,but would be of above average quality.Westgate Town Center fulfills those needs for us.We will be returning again and again.Our pleasant experience began with the price.We found a website that cut more than 1/2 off retail.A good start.Watching the weather we booked inside the website's cancellation period and were rewarded with sunny days.We arrived early and were allowed to check in a full FOUR HOURS before the official check in time (based upon available units).Our "studio" was actually a small apartment with a balcony.It had a limited kitchen (to save big $$$ over eating at restaurants while in Orlando) with a coffee maker,toaster,microwave,standard refrigerator,sink,utensils,cutlery,plates,glasses,bowls, and even a corkscrew.The unit also had a table with chairs for four people,a real leather pull out queen sleeper sofa,a table and two chairs on the SCREENED balcony cable TV.That's not all.In the shared bath (that has two locking entrance doors...one into the master suite and one into the common room itself) there is real granite,a triangular jacuzzi tub/shower a hair dryer and all necessary toiletries.The master bedroom has another locking door (both may be locked for privacy from the kids) another TV, a safe, bureaus, vertical blinds,a queen sized comfy bed and an alarm clock/radio.Tile throughout.There is even an ironing board.The property has community laundry facilitiees.The studio has no washer/dryer but larger units likely have them.Amenities include putt putt golf,eight swimming pools,kiddie pools,outdoor jacuzzis and tennis.There are also paddleboats and activites co ordinators/programs.In the future,there will be a full service spa for the ladies, a huge waterpark for the kids and an improved clubhouse for everyone.In the registration building there is a bistro style food service operation as well as a movie theater (free) that shows Disney films.Express checkout consists of calling the front desk,settling charges and dropping off the key as you leave.There is NO full service restaurant but that is common in other types of resorts.This is a timeshare resort.People go there, or buy there to,among other things, save money cooking in the units.You WILL be offered a timeshare presentation when you check in,in exchange for freebies. That's your call.Not mandatory unless you previously agreed to take one.All staff members that we encountered were friendly,helpful,courteous,efficient and knowlegeable. I give this resort four stars on a one to five scale.The amenities are there,or coming soon (waterpark,spa etc...) for a five star resort.The units were new and immaculate,spacious and quiet (cinder block construction). However, it did not "feel" five star.It did not shout "luxury" (along with the high prices) but it is solidly respectable, attractive,clean,updated and affordable.One main drawback is the lack of free wireless internet.The pay plan was too expensive as well.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, but Location is Misleading”
Reviews.Author: DayTripper247
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio room in this hotel complex in mid-March 2010. Our room was decent but small. Our refrigerator didn't work, but when I called the maintenance staff, they came within half an hour to fix it. After they determined it was indeed broken, they brought in a new refrigerator within another half an hour or so. On the other hand, we also found some of the hotel staff to be a bit pushy - the cleaning lady knocked on our door well before check-out time, asking when we were leaving, and the bell hop insisted on following me into my room and pretended to "check on things" until I produced a tip. My main issue with this hotel is that the location is not as close to Disney as it says it is. It might be around a mile from some part of the Disney Park complex to this hotel, but it is much farther than a mile to the Ticket and Transportation Center. Moreover, I didn't rent a car because I figured we could catch a cab for a small amount of money given the short distance; instead, it costs $50 round trip to go from the hotel to Disney. You can take the public bus (you have to take two buses and switch lines), but that can be a bit of a pain. Overall, the resort is not friendly toward those who don't have a rental car - it's a mile walk to get from the back of the resort out to the main road.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: BabyNelson
Reviews.Content: We haven't even gotten there yet, but when I have tried to call and ask a question, I have never had a telephone hold time less than 25 minutes without any check from an operator. Today I called to make sure our suite was handicapped accessible for my father. When the operator put me through to the room assignments people, I started my kitchen timer and looked at the clock on my computer. Twenty-five minutes later, I hung up and called back. Get this - the operator accused me of LYING about my wait time, because she had put someone through 5 minutes earlier who also needed a handicapped room. Based on the difficulty in reaching any kind of customer service representative and the ensuing disappointment once I reached them, I would never ever book a vacation at this resort again, no matter the price or convenience.
